notnormal.gui.not_normal_gui

This module is the GUI for the NotNormal algorithm. It is inefficient, has bugs, but it works and is functional. In the future, it will be replaced with a more efficient and better designed GUI

  52@lru_cache(maxsize=200)
  53def _get_edges(length, max_points):
  54    # Equally spaced bin edges
  55    k = np.arange(max_points, dtype=np.int64)
  56    starts = (k * np.int64(length)) // np.int64(max_points)
  57    ends = np.empty_like(starts)
  58    ends[:len(ends) - 1] = starts[1:]
  59    ends[len(ends) - 1] = length
  60    return starts, ends

  63class CustomFigureCanvas(FigureCanvasTkAgg):
  64    def __init__(self, figure, window, root):
  65        super().__init__(figure, window)
  66        self.root = root
  67        self.after_id = None
  68
  69    def resize(self, event):
  70        if self.after_id is not None:
  71            self.root.after_cancel(self.after_id)
  72        self.after_id = self.root.after(100, self.do_resize, event)
  73
  74    def do_resize(self, event):
  75        self.after_id = None
  76        super(CustomFigureCanvas, self).resize(event)

  79class FeatureWindow(tk.Toplevel):

  86        # Title

  88        # Background
  89        self.configure(bg="black")

  91        if sys.platform == 'win32':

  93        else:

  96        self.geometry(f'{master.width // 2}x{master.height // 2}+{master.width // 4}+{master.height // 4}')
  97        self.state('normal')

 218    def init_layout(self):
 219        # Main window
 220        self.windows['main'] = ttk.Frame(self)
 221        self.windows['main'].pack(fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True)
 222        # Left window
 223        self.windows['left'] = ttk.Frame(self.windows['main'], style='secondary.TFrame')
 224        # Right window
 225        self.windows['right'] = ttk.Frame(self.windows['main'], style='secondary.TFrame')
 226
 227        # Main layout
 228        self.windows['main'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 229        self.windows['main'].columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
 230        self.windows['left'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")
 231        self.windows['right'].grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="nsew")
 232
 233        # Left (options window)
 234        self.windows['options'] = ttk.Frame(self.windows['left'], style='primary.TFrame')
 235        # Right (feature view window)
 236        self.windows['feature_view'] = ttk.Frame(self.windows['right'], style='primary.TFrame')
 237
 238        # Left layout
 239        self.windows['left'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1, minsize=self.master.width // 6)
 240        self.windows['left'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 241        self.windows['options'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=(_WINDOW_PADDING, 0), pady=_WINDOW_PADDING)
 242        # Right layout
 243        self.windows['right'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 244        self.windows['right'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 245        self.windows['feature_view'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_WINDOW_PADDING, pady=_WINDOW_PADDING)
 246
 247    def init_options(self):
 248        self.widgets['options'] = dict()
 249        # Options title
 250        self.widgets['options']['title'] = ttk.Label(self.windows['options'], text="Options",
 251                                                     style='primary.Inverse.TLabel', anchor='center')
 252        # Internal frame
 253        self.windows['options_internal'] = ttk.Frame(self.windows['options'])
 254        # Layout
 255        self.windows['options'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 256        self.windows['options'].rowconfigure(1, weight=1)
 257        self.widgets['options']['title'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew", pady=(_WINDOW_PADDING, 0))
 258        self.windows['options_internal'].grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_WINDOW_PADDING, pady=_WINDOW_PADDING)
 259
 260        # Options notebook
 261        self.widgets['options']['notebook'] = ttk.Notebook(self.windows['options_internal'])
 262        self.widgets['options']['notebook'].enable_traversal()
 263        self.widgets['options']['notebook'].bind("<<NotebookTabChanged>>", lambda _: self.set_current_figure())
 264        # Layout
 265        self.windows['options_internal'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 266        self.windows['options_internal'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 267        self.widgets['options']['notebook'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")

 282    def create_options_tab(self, figure_config: dict, index: int = None):
 283        label = figure_config['label']
 284
 285        # Tab widgets
 286        self.widgets['options'][label] = dict()
 287        widgets = self.widgets['options'][label]
 288
 289        # Tab frame and separator
 290        widgets['frame'] = ttk.Frame(self.widgets['options']['notebook'])
 291        widgets['header_separator'] = ttk.Separator(widgets['frame'], style='primary.TSeparator')
 292        # Tab layout (column 0 is for labels, column 1 is for inputs)
 293        widgets['frame'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1, uniform=label)
 294        widgets['frame'].columnconfigure(1, weight=2, uniform=label)
 295        widgets['header_separator'].grid(row=0, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
 296        # Add tab
 297        if index is None or index >= self.widgets['options']['notebook'].index('end'):
 298            self.widgets['options']['notebook'].add(widgets['frame'], text=label)
 299        else:
 300            self.widgets['options']['notebook'].insert(index, widgets['frame'], text=label)
 301
 302        # Plot and axis options
 303        self.plot_options[label] = dict()
 304        self.axis_options[label] = dict()
 305        self.axis_func_options[label] = dict()
 306        self.feature_filters[label] = dict()
 307        opt_length = (len(figure_config['axis_options']) + len(figure_config['plot_options']) +
 308                      len(figure_config['axis_func_options']) + len(figure_config['feature_filters']))
 309
 310        i = 1
 311        for tk_var, options in [(self.plot_options[label], figure_config['plot_options']),
 312                                (self.axis_options[label], figure_config['axis_options']),
 313                                (self.axis_func_options[label], figure_config['axis_func_options']),
 314                                (self.feature_filters[label], figure_config['feature_filters'])]:
 315            for opt in options.keys():
 316                # Tk variables
 317                if options[opt]['type'] in ['str', 'colour', 'feature']:
 318                    tk_var[opt] = tk.StringVar()
 319                elif options[opt]['type'] == 'int':
 320                    tk_var[opt] = tk.IntVar()
 321                elif options[opt]['type'] == 'float':
 322                    tk_var[opt] = tk.DoubleVar()
 323                elif options[opt]['type'] == 'bool':
 324                    tk_var[opt] = tk.BooleanVar()
 325
 326                # Default
 327                tk_var[opt].set(options[opt]['default'])
 328
 329                # Label
 330                widgets['frame'].rowconfigure(i, weight=1, uniform=label)
 331                widgets[opt + '_label'] = ttk.Label(widgets['frame'], text=options[opt]['label'])
 332                widgets[opt + '_label'].grid(row=i, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING)
 333
 334                # Entry
 335                if options[opt]['type'] in ['str', 'feature']:
 336                    widgets[opt] = ttk.Combobox(
 337                        widgets['frame'],
 338                        textvariable=tk_var[opt],
 339                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH,
 340                        justify='center',
 341                        values=options[opt]['values'],
 342                        state='readonly'
 343                    )
 344                    widgets[opt].bind("<<ComboboxSelected>>", lambda _, x = options[opt]['relim']: (
 345                                                                self.update_figure(figure_config, relim=x)))
 346                    widgets[opt].grid(row=i, column=1, sticky="e", padx=_PADDING)
 347                    widgets[opt].configure(font=self.master.fonts['small'])
 348                elif options[opt]['type'] in ['int', 'float']:
 349                    widgets[opt] = ttk.Spinbox(
 350                        widgets['frame'],
 351                        textvariable=tk_var[opt],
 352                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH,
 353                        justify='center',
 354                        from_=options[opt]['values'][0],
 355                        to=options[opt]['values'][1],
 356                        increment=options[opt]['values'][2],
 357                        command=partial(self.update_figure, figure_config, relim=options[opt]['relim'])
 358                    )
 359                    widgets[opt].grid(row=i, column=1, sticky="e", padx=_PADDING)
 360                    widgets[opt].configure(font=self.master.fonts['small'])
 361                elif options[opt]['type'] == 'bool':
 362                    widgets[opt] = ttk.Checkbutton(
 363                        widgets['frame'],
 364                        variable=tk_var[opt],
 365                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH - 5,
 366                        onvalue=True,
 367                        offvalue=False,
 368                        command=partial(self.update_figure, figure_config, relim=options[opt]['relim']),
 369                        style='Roundtoggle.Toolbutton'
 370                    )
 371                    widgets[opt].grid(row=i, column=1, sticky="e", padx=_PADDING)
 372                elif options[opt]['type'] == 'colour':
 373                    widgets[opt] = ttk.Button(
 374                        widgets['frame'],
 375                        command=partial(self.update_colour, figure_config, opt),
 376                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH - 3
 377                    )
 378                    self.master.style.configure(
 379                        f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{opt}_colour.TButton', background=tk_var[opt].get(), borderwidth=0)
 380                    self.master.style.map(f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{opt}_colour.TButton',
 381                                          background=[('active', tk_var[opt].get())])
 382                    widgets[opt].configure(style=f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{opt}_colour.TButton')
 383                    widgets[opt].grid(row=i, column=1, sticky="e", padx=_PADDING, pady=6)
 384
 385                # Separator
 386                if i < (2 * opt_length) - 1:
 387                    widgets[opt + '_separator'] = ttk.Separator(widgets['frame'], orient='horizontal')
 388                    widgets[opt + '_separator'].grid(row=i + 1, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
 389
 390                i += 2
 391
 392        # Add config button
 393        widgets['config_button'] = ttk.Button(widgets['frame'], text="Edit Configuration", underline=0,
 394                                              command=partial(self.create_edit_window, figure_config),
 395                                              style='secondary.Outline.TButton')
 396        self.bind('<Control-a>', lambda _: partial(self.create_edit_window, figure_config))
 397        widgets['config_button'].grid(row=i, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew", pady=(0, _PADDING), padx=_PADDING)
 398
 399    def create_figure_frame(self, figure_config: dict):
 400        label = figure_config['label']
 401        sub_plot_init = figure_config['sub_plot_init']
 402
 403        # Figure frame widgets
 404        self.widgets['feature_view'][label] = dict()
 405        widgets = self.widgets['feature_view'][label]
 406
 407
 408        widgets['frame'] = ttk.Frame(self.windows['feature_view_internal'])
 409        # configure layout (do not place frame in grid as this is done dynamically)
 410        self.windows['feature_view_internal'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 411        self.windows['feature_view_internal'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 412        # Figure and canvas
 413        widgets['fig'] = Figure(layout='constrained', figsize=(1, 1))
 414        widgets['canvas'] = FigureCanvasTkAgg(widgets['fig'], widgets['frame'])
 415        widgets['canvas'].draw()
 416        # Toolbar
 417        widgets['toolbar'] = NavigationToolbar2Tk(widgets['canvas'], widgets['frame'], pack_toolbar=False)
 418        for child in widgets['toolbar'].winfo_children():
 419            child.pack_forget()
 420            child.configure(background='white', border=1)
 421        for child in widgets['toolbar'].winfo_children():
 422            if child != widgets['toolbar'].children['!button4']:
 423                child.pack(side=tk.LEFT)
 424        widgets['toolbar'].update()
 425        # Toolbar separator
 426        widgets['toolbar_separator'] = ttk.Separator(widgets['frame'])
 427        # Frame layout
 428        widgets['frame'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 429        widgets['frame'].rowconfigure(2, weight=1)
 430        widgets['toolbar'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky='nsew', padx=_PADDING)
 431        widgets['toolbar_separator'].grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="nsew")
 432        widgets['canvas'].get_tk_widget().grid(row=2, column=0, sticky='nsew', padx=2 * _PADDING, pady=2 * _PADDING)
 433
 434        # Feature view
 435        widgets['fig'].add_subplot(111, **sub_plot_init)
 436
 437        # Bind events
 438        widgets['canvas'].mpl_connect("pick_event", self.pick_event)
 439
 440    def update_colour(self, figure_config: dict, option: str):
 441        label = figure_config['label']
 442        plot_options = self.plot_options[label]
 443        widgets = self.widgets['options'][label]
 444
 445        colour = colorchooser.askcolor(title="Choose color", initialcolor=plot_options[option].get())[1]
 446        if colour is None:
 447            return
 448
 449        plot_options[option].set(colour)
 450        self.master.style.configure(
 451            f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{option}_colour.TButton', background=plot_options[option].get(),)
 452        self.master.style.map(f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{option}_colour.TButton',
 453                              background=[('active', plot_options[option].get())])
 454        widgets[option].configure(style=f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{option}_colour.TButton')
 455
 456        self.update_figure(figure_config)
 457
 458    def update_figure(self, figure_config: dict, relim: bool = False):
 459        label = figure_config['label']
 460        function = figure_config['function']
 461        plot_init = figure_config['plot_init']
 462        plot_options = figure_config['plot_options']
 463        axis_init = figure_config['axis_init']
 464        axis_options = figure_config['axis_options']
 465        axis_func_init = figure_config['axis_func_init']
 466        axis_func_options = figure_config['axis_func_options']
 467
 468        # Get and clear axis
 469        ax = self.widgets['feature_view'][label]['fig'].axes[0]
 470        view_limits = (ax.get_xlim(), ax.get_ylim())
 471
 472        try:
 473            ax.clear()
 474
 475            # Get the filtered event IDs
 476            event_ids = self.get_filtered_ids(figure_config)
 477
 478            # Get figure options
 479            options = dict()
 480            current_features = []
 481            for option in plot_options.keys():
 482                if plot_options[option]['type'] == 'feature':
 483                    options[option] = self.events.get_feature(self.plot_options[label][option].get(), event_ids)
 484                    current_features.append(self.plot_options[label][option].get())
 485                else:
 486                    options[option] = self.plot_options[label][option].get()
 487
 488            # Plot
 489            plot = getattr(ax, function)(**options, **plot_init, picker=True)
 490
 491            # Get axis options
 492            options = dict()
 493            for option in axis_options.keys():
 494                options[option] = self.axis_options[label][option].get()
 495
 496            # Set axis options
 497            ax.set(**options, **axis_init, label=str(current_features))
 498
 499            # Title
 500            if 'title' not in axis_init.keys():
 501                ax.set_title(self.events.label, fontsize=_LARGE_FONT)
 502            # Labels
 503            if 'xlabel' not in axis_init.keys():
 504                ax.set_xlabel(current_features[0], fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
 505            if 'ylabel' not in axis_init.keys() and len(current_features) > 1:
 506                ax.set_ylabel(current_features[1], fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
 507            if 'zlabel' not in axis_init.keys() and len(current_features) > 2:
 508                ax.set_zlabel(current_features[2], rotation=90, fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
 509
 510            # Set default axis func options
 511            for option in axis_func_init.keys():
 512                getattr(ax, option)(**axis_func_init[option])
 513
 514            # Set axis func options
 515            for option in axis_func_options.keys():
 516                getattr(ax, option)(self.axis_func_options[label][option].get(),
 517                                    **axis_func_options[option].get('kwargs', {}))
 518
 519
 520            # Update data limits
 521            if relim:
 522                try:
 523                    ax.ignore_existing_data_limits = True
 524                    ax.update_datalim(plot.get_datalim(ax.transData))
 525                except AttributeError:
 526                    ax.relim()
 527                ax.autoscale(True)
 528                self.widgets['feature_view'][label]['toolbar'].update()
 529                self.widgets['feature_view'][label]['toolbar'].push_current()
 530            else:
 531                ax.set_xlim(view_limits[0])
 532                ax.set_ylim(view_limits[1])
 533
 534            # Draw
 535            self.widgets['feature_view'][label]['canvas'].draw_idle()
 536            self.widgets['feature_view'][label]['canvas'].flush_events()
 537
 538        except Exception:
 539            ax.set_xlim(view_limits[0])
 540            ax.set_ylim(view_limits[1])
 541            return
 542
 543    def update_current_figure(self, relim: bool = False):
 544        config = self.figure_configs[self.current_figure]
 545        self.update_figure(config, relim)
 546
 547    def update_all_figures(self, relim: bool = False):
 548        for config in self.figure_configs:
 549            self.update_figure(config, relim)

 551    def create_edit_window(self, figure_config: dict):
 552        self.windows['edit_config'] = dict()
 553        self.windows['edit_config']['windows'] = dict()
 554        self.windows['edit_config']['widgets'] = dict()
 555        windows = self.windows['edit_config']['windows']
 556        widgets = self.windows['edit_config']['widgets']
 557
 558        windows['top_level'] = tk.Toplevel(self)
 559        windows['top_level'].attributes('-topmost', 1)
 560        windows['top_level'].title("Edit Configuration")
 561        windows['top_level'].configure(bg="black")
 562        if sys.platform == 'win32':
 563            windows['top_level'].iconbitmap(True, self.master.icon)
 564        else:
 565            windows['top_level'].iconphoto(True, self.master.icon)
 566        windows['top_level'].geometry(
 567            f'{self.master.width // 2}x{self.master.height // 2}+{self.master.width // 4}+{self.master.height // 4}')
 568        windows['top_level'].state('normal')
 569        windows['top_level'].resizable(True, True)
 570
 571        # Main window
 572        windows['main'] = ttk.Frame(windows['top_level'])
 573        windows['main'].pack(fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True)
 574        # Center window
 575        windows['center'] = ttk.Frame(windows['main'], style='secondary.TFrame')
 576
 577        # Main layout
 578        windows['main'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 579        windows['main'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 580        windows['center'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")
 581
 582        # Options window
 583        windows['config'] = ttk.Frame(windows['center'], style='primary.TFrame')
 584
 585        # Layout
 586        windows['center'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 587        windows['center'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 588        windows['config'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_WINDOW_PADDING, pady=_WINDOW_PADDING)
 589
 590        # Title and inner frame
 591        widgets['title'] = ttk.Label(windows['config'], text="JSON Configuration", style='primary.Inverse.TLabel',
 592                                     anchor='center')
 593        windows['config_internal'] = ttk.Frame(windows['config'])
 594        # Layout
 595        windows['config'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 596        windows['config'].rowconfigure(1, weight=1)
 597        widgets['title'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew", pady=(_WINDOW_PADDING, 0))
 598        windows['config_internal'].grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_WINDOW_PADDING, pady=_WINDOW_PADDING)
 599
 600        # Entry
 601        size = self.master.fonts['small'].measure('    ')
 602        widgets['entry'] = tk.Text(windows['config_internal'], tabs=size, font=self.master.fonts['small'])
 603        windows['config_internal'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1, uniform=1)
 604        windows['config_internal'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1, uniform=1)
 605        widgets['entry'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING, pady=(0, _PADDING))
 606
 607        widgets['add_button'] = ttk.Button(windows['config_internal'], text="Confirm", underline=0,
 608                                           command=partial(self.edit_figure_config, figure_config),
 609                                           style='secondary.Outline.TButton')
 610        widgets['add_button'].grid(row=1, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew", pady=(0, _PADDING), padx=_PADDING)
 611
 612        # Create a new tag
 613        widgets['entry'].tag_configure('JSON', foreground=self.master.colours['trace'])
 614
 615        # Convert to json
 616        widgets['entry'].insert(tk.END, dumps(figure_config, indent=4))

 618    def edit_figure_config(self, figure_config: dict):
 619        # Get the new config
 620        config = self.windows['edit_config']['widgets']['entry'].get('1.0', 'end')
 621
 622        # Replace 'features' with the features
 623        config = config.replace('features', str(self.features))
 624        for i in range(100):
 625            if f'features[{i}]' in config:
 626                config = config.replace(f'features[{i}]', f'"{self.features[i]}"')
 627
 628        # Convert the config back to a dictionary
 629        try:
 630            config = loads(config)
 631        except JSONDecodeError:
 632            messagebox.showerror("Error", "Invalid JSON configuration")
 633            return
 634
 635        # Parse the config
 636        try:
 637            config = self.parse_figure_config(config)
 638        except ValueError as e:
 639            messagebox.showerror("Error", e)
 640            return
 641
 642        # Replace the old config
 643        current_config = self.get_figure_config(figure_config['label'])
 644        current_config.update(config)
 645        # Get the tab index
 646        index = self.widgets['options']['notebook'].index(self.widgets['options'][figure_config['label']]['frame'])
 647        # Remove the old figure and tab
 648        self.remove_figure_config(current_config)
 649
 650        # Add figure frame
 651        self.create_figure_frame(figure_config)
 652        # Add options tab
 653        self.create_options_tab(figure_config, index)
 654        self.set_current_tab(figure_config['label'])
 655        # Update the figure
 656        self.update_figure(figure_config, relim=True)
 657
 658        # Destroy the window
 659        self.windows['edit_config']['windows']['top_level'].destroy()
 660
 661    def add_figure_config(self, figure_config: dict):
 662        # Parse the figure configuration
 663        if figure_config['label'] in [config['label'] for config in self.figure_configs]:
 664            messagebox.showerror("Error", "label already exists in figure configurations")
 665            return
 666        try:
 667            figure_config = self.parse_figure_config(figure_config)
 668        except ValueError as e:
 669            messagebox.showerror("Error", e)
 670            return
 671
 672        # Add to the list of figures and configs
 673        self.figure_configs.append(figure_config)
 674        # Add figure frame
 675        self.create_figure_frame(figure_config)
 676        # Add options tab
 677        self.create_options_tab(figure_config)
 678        # Update the figure
 679        self.update_figure(figure_config, relim=True)
 680
 681    def remove_figure_config(self, figure_config: dict):
 682        # Remove the figure frame
 683        self.widgets['feature_view'][figure_config['label']]['frame'].destroy()
 684        # Remove the options tab
 685        self.widgets['options'][figure_config['label']]['frame'].destroy()
 686        # Update the current figure
 687        self.current_figure = None
 688        self.set_current_figure()
 689
 690    @staticmethod
 691    def parse_figure_config(figure_config: dict):
 692        # Label
 693        if not 'label' in figure_config.keys():
 694            raise ValueError("label not found in figure configuration")
 695        if type(figure_config['label']) != str:
 696            raise ValueError("label must be a string")
 697
 698        # Function
 699        if not 'function' in figure_config.keys():
 700            raise ValueError("function not found in figure configuration")
 701        if type(figure_config['function']) != str:
 702            raise ValueError("function must be a string")
 703        if not hasattr(Axes, figure_config['function']):
 704            raise ValueError("function not found in matplotlib Axes")
 705
 706        # Optional config keys
 707        for key in ['sub_plot_init', 'axis_init', 'axis_func_init', 'plot_init', 'axis_options', 'axis_func_options',
 708                    'plot_options', 'feature_filters']:
 709            if not key in figure_config.keys() or figure_config[key] is None:
 710                figure_config[key] = {}
 711            if type(figure_config[key]) != dict:
 712                raise ValueError(f"{key} must be a dictionary")
 713
 714        # Options keys
 715        for key in ['axis_options', 'axis_func_options', 'plot_options', 'feature_filters']:
 716            for subkey in figure_config[key].keys():
 717                if type(figure_config[key][subkey]) != dict:
 718                    raise ValueError(f"{subkey} in {key} must be a dictionary")
 719                if not 'label' in figure_config[key][subkey].keys():
 720                    raise ValueError("{subkey} in {key} must have a label")
 721                if not 'relim' in figure_config[key][subkey].keys():
 722                    raise ValueError("{subkey} in {key} must have a relim option")
 723                if not 'type' in figure_config[key][subkey].keys():
 724                    raise ValueError("{subkey} in {key} must have a type option")
 725                if not 'default' in figure_config[key][subkey].keys():
 726                    raise ValueError("{subkey} in {key} must have a default option")
 727
 728        # Plot options
 729        if not len(figure_config['plot_options']):
 730            raise ValueError("plot_options cannot be empty")
 731
 732        # Axis functions
 733        for key in ['axis_func_init', 'axis_func_options']:
 734            for subkey in figure_config[key].keys():
 735                if not hasattr(Axes, subkey):
 736                    raise ValueError(f"{subkey} not found in matplotlib Axes")
 737
 738        return figure_config
 739
 740    def get_filtered_ids(self, figure_config: dict):
 741        label = figure_config['label']
 742        feature_filters = figure_config['feature_filters']
 743
 744        # Get feature filters
 745        filters = [(key, self.feature_filters[label][key].get()) for key in feature_filters.keys()]
 746        # Remove 'all' values
 747        items = []
 748        for key, value in filters:
 749            if value == 'all':
 750                continue
 751            if value == True and feature_filters[key].get('onvalue') == 'all':
 752                continue
 753            if value == False and feature_filters[key].get('offvalue') == 'all':
 754                continue
 755            items.append((key, value))
 756
 757        event_ids = []
 758        # Get event IDs that match the filters
 759        for event in self.events:
 760            if not all([event[key] == value for key, value in items]):
 761                continue
 762            else:
 763                event_ids.append(event['ID'])
 764
 765        return event_ids
 766
 767    def get_figure_config(self, label: str):
 768        for config in self.figure_configs:
 769            if config['label'] == label:
 770                return config
 771
 772    def set_current_tab(self, label: str):
 773        for i in self.widgets['options']['notebook'].tabs():
 774            if self.widgets['options']['notebook'].tab(i, "text") == label:
 775                self.widgets['options']['notebook'].select(i)
 776                break
 777
 778    def set_current_figure(self):
 779        # Hide the previous plot
 780        if self.current_figure:
 781            self.widgets['feature_view'][self.current_figure]['frame'].grid_forget()
 782        # Currently selected tab
 783        tab_id = self.widgets['options']['notebook'].select()
 784        self.current_figure = self.widgets['options']['notebook'].tab(tab_id, "text")
 785        # Show the new plot
 786        self.widgets['feature_view'][self.current_figure]['frame'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")
 787
 788    def pick_event(self, event):
 789        point = []
 790        if isinstance(event.artist, Line2D):
 791            point = [event.artist.get_xdata()[event.ind[0]], event.artist.get_ydata()[event.ind[0]]]
 792        elif isinstance(event.artist, Path3DCollection):
 793            point = [event.artist._offsets3d[0][event.ind[0]], event.artist._offsets3d[1][event.ind[0]],
 794                     event.artist._offsets3d[2][event.ind[0]]]
 795        elif isinstance(event.artist, PathCollection):
 796            point = [event.artist.get_offsets()[event.ind[0]][0], event.artist.get_offsets()[event.ind[0]][1]]
 797        elif isinstance(event.artist, Rectangle):
 798            point = [event.artist.get_x()]
 799
 800        feature_names = literal_eval(event.canvas.figure.axes[0].get_label())
 801
 802        if len(feature_names) != len(point):
 803            return
 804
 805        event_id = None
 806        for e in self.events:
 807            if all([point[i] == e[feature_names[i]] for i in range(len(feature_names))]):
 808                event_id = e['ID']
 809                break
 810
 811        if event_id is None:
 812            return
 813
 814        # Get currently shown events
 815        label = self.events.label
 816
 817        # Select the tab
 818        for i in self.master.widgets['results']['notebook'].tabs():
 819            if self.master.widgets['results']['notebook'].tab(i, "text") == label:
 820                self.master.widgets['results']['notebook'].select(i)
 821                break
 822
 823        # Get the treeview
 824        tab = self.master.widgets['results']['notebook'].nametowidget(
 825            self.master.widgets['results']['notebook'].select())
 826        tree = tab.winfo_children()[2].winfo_children()[0]
 827
 828        # Select the event
 829        for item in tree.get_children():
 830            if tree.item(item, 'text') == str(event_id):
 831                tree.selection_set(item)
 832                tree.focus(item)
 833                tree.see(item)
 834                dummy = tk.Event()
 835                dummy.widget = tree
 836                self.master.jump_to_event(label, dummy)
 837                break
 838

1011    def init_layout(self):
1012        # Main window
1013        self.windows['main'] = ttk.Frame(self)
1014        self.windows['main'].pack(fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True)
1015        # Left window
1016        self.windows['left'] = ttk.Frame(self.windows['main'], style='secondary.TFrame')
1017        # Center window

1053    def init_binds(self):
1054        self.bind('<Control-b>', lambda event: self.load_trace())
1055        self.bind('<Control-e>', lambda event: self.initial_estimate())
1056        self.bind('<Control-i>', lambda event: self.iterate())
1057        self.bind('<Control-s>', lambda event: self.save_results())
1058        self.bind('<o>', lambda event: self.toggle_analysis_view_options())

1564    def init_slider(self):
1565        if type(self.time_vector) is not np.ndarray:
1566            return
1567
1568        limits = (self.time_vector[0], self.time_vector[len(self.time_vector) - 1])
1569        padding = (limits[1] - limits[0]) / 20
1570        limits = (limits[0] - padding, limits[1] + padding)
1571        slider = self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider']
1572        slider.eventson = False
1573        slider.valmin = limits[0]
1574        slider.valmax = limits[1]
1575        slider.valinit = limits
1576        slider.valstep = self.time_step
1577        slider.set_val(limits)
1578        slider.ax.set_xlim(limits)
1579        slider.eventson = True
1580

1640            self.default_figure_options[option[0]] = dict()
1641            self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]] = dict()

1663                                                                          columnspan=len(options) + 1, sticky="nsew")

1665            j = 1
1666            for option in options:
1667                # General configuration
1668                if option[1] == 'bool':

1671                        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1672                        variable=self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]],
1673                        command=partial(option[2],key[0]),
1674                        style='Roundtoggle.Toolbutton',
1675                    )
1676                elif option[1] == 'float':
1677                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]] = tk.DoubleVar()
1678                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]] = ttk.Spinbox(
1679                        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1680                        textvariable=self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]],
1681                        format='%2.1f',
1682                        command=partial(option[2], key[0]),
1683                        justify='center',
1684                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH
1685                    )
1686                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].bind("<Return>", lambda _: partial(option[2], key[0]))
1687                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].bind("<FocusOut>", lambda _: partial(option[2], key[0]))
1688                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].configure(font=self.fonts['small'])
1689                elif option[1] == 'colour':
1690                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]] = tk.StringVar()
1691                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]] = ttk.Button(
1692                        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1693                        command=partial(option[2],key[0]),
1694                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH - 3,
1695                    )
1696                elif option[1] == 'str':
1697                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]] = tk.StringVar()
1698                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]] = ttk.Combobox(
1699                        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1700                        textvariable=self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]],
1701                        state='readonly',
1702                        justify='center',
1703                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH
1704                    )
1705                    self.widgets['analysis_view']['style'][key[0]].bind('<<ComboboxSelected>>', lambda _, x = key[0]:
1706                                                                        option[2](x))
1707                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].configure(font=self.fonts['small'])
1708
1709                # Specific configuration
1710                if option[0] == 'show':
1711                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]].set(True if key[0] in ['trace', 'baseline', 'threshold'] else
1712                                                               False)
1713                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].grid(row=i, column=j, padx=(_PADDING + 3, _PADDING),
1714                                                                          pady=(1, 0))
1715                elif option[0] == 'linewidth':
1716                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]].set(1.0)
1717                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].configure(from_=0, to=4, increment=0.1)
1718                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].grid(row=i, column=j, padx=_PADDING)
1719                elif option[0] == 'colour':
1720                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]].set(self.colours[key[0]])
1721                    self.style.configure(f'{key[0]}_colour.TButton', background=self.colours[key[0]],
1722                                         borderwidth=0)
1723                    self.style.map(f'{key[0]}_colour.TButton', background=[('active', self.colours[key[0]])])
1724                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].configure(style=f'{key[0]}_colour.TButton')
1725                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].grid(row=i, column=j, padx=_PADDING)
1726                elif option[0] == 'style':
1727                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]].set('-')
1728                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].configure(values=['-', '--', ':', '-.'])
1729                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].grid(row=i, column=j, padx=_PADDING)
1730
1731
1732                self.default_figure_options[option[0]][key[0]] = self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]].get()
1733                j += 1
1734
1735            i += 2
1736
1737        # Add grid to the top left corner
1738        self.figure_options['grid'] = tk.BooleanVar(value=False)
1739        self.default_figure_options['grid'] = self.figure_options['grid'].get()
1740        self.widgets['analysis_view']['grid'] = ttk.Button(
1741            self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1742            text='Grid',
1743            width=_ENTRY_WIDTH,
1744            command=self.update_figure_grid,

1746        )

1782    def reset_load(self):
1783        if self.flags['running']:
1784            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
1785            return
1786
1787        # Reset the trace vectors
1788        self.trace = None
1789        self.time_vector = None
1790        self.time_step = None
1791        # Clear the trace information
1792        for key in self.trace_information:
1793            self.trace_information[key].set('')
1794        self.trace_information['units'].set('pA')
1795        # Set the flags
1796        self.flags['loaded'] = False
1797
1798    def reset_algorithm(self):
1799        for key in self.default_analysis_options:
1800            self.analysis_options[key].set(self.default_analysis_options[key])
1801        # Disable iterate options
1802        self.toggle_iterate_options(['disabled'])
1803
1804    def reset_figure(self):
1805        # Reset the figure options
1806        for key in self.default_figure_options:
1807            if isinstance(self.default_figure_options[key], dict):
1808                for sub_key in self.default_figure_options[key]:
1809                    self.figure_options[key][sub_key].set(self.default_figure_options[key][sub_key])
1810                    if key == 'colour':
1811                        colour = self.default_figure_options[key][sub_key]
1812                        self.style.configure(
1813                            f'{sub_key}_colour.TButton',
1814                            background=colour,
1815                            bordercolor=colour,
1816                            lightcolor=colour,
1817                            darkcolor=colour
1818                        )
1819                        self.style.map(
1820                            f'{sub_key}_colour.TButton',
1821                            background=[('active', colour)],
1822                            bordercolor=[('active', colour)],
1823                            lightcolor=[('active', colour)],
1824                            darkcolor=[('active', colour)]
1825                        )
1826                        self.widgets['analysis_view']['colour'][sub_key].configure(style=f'{sub_key}_colour.TButton')
1827            else:
1828                self.figure_options[key].set(self.default_figure_options[key])
1829        # Update the figure
1830        self.update_figure(retain_view=False)
1831
1832    def reset_results(self):
1833        # Reset the trace vectors
1834        self.filtered_trace = None
1835        self.baseline = None
1836        self.pos_threshold = None
1837        self.neg_threshold = None
1838        self.calculation_trace = None
1839        self.event_coordinates = None
1840        # Clear the results
1841        self.analysis_results = dict()
1842        # Update the results
1843        self.update_results()
1844        # Update the figure
1845        self.update_figure(title=' ')
1846        # Set the flags
1847        self.flags['estimated'] = False
1848        self.flags['iterated'] = False
1849        self.flags['saved'] = False

1851    def reset_all(self):
1852        if self.flags['running']:
1853            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
1854            return
1855
1856        # Reset the load window
1857        self.reset_load()
1858        # Reset the 'analyse' window
1859        self.reset_algorithm()
1860        # Reset the results window
1861        self.reset_results()
1862        # Reset the analysis view window
1863        self.reset_figure()

1865    def update_load(self, path):
1866        self.trace_information['path'].set(path)
1867
1868        if path != '':
1869            if len(basename(path)) > 63:
1870                self.trace_information['filename'].set(f'{basename(path)[0:60]}...')
1871            else:
1872                self.trace_information['filename'].set(basename(path))
1873
1874        if self.trace is not None:
1875            self.trace_information['samples'].set(f'{len(self.trace):.0f}')
1876
1877        if self.time_vector is not None:
1878            self.trace_information['sample_rate'].set(f'{1 / self.time_step:.0f}')
1879
1880        if self.time_vector is not None:
1881            self.trace_information['duration'].set(f'{self.time_vector[len(self.time_vector) - 1] - self.time_vector[0]:.1f}')
1882
1883    def update_units(self):
1884        units = self.trace_information['units'].get()
1885        if 'analysis_view' not in self.widgets:
1886            return
1887        if not units:
1888            return
1889        ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
1890        ax.set_ylabel("Current" + f' (${units}$)', fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
1891
1892        if units == 'A':
1893            tooltip.Hovertip(self.widgets['load']['units'], f'Amplitude: A, Duration: ms, Area: C',
1894                             hover_delay=300)
1895        else:
1896            tooltip.Hovertip(self.widgets['load']['units'], f'Amplitude: {units[0]}A, Duration: ms, Area: {units[0]}C',
1897                             hover_delay=300)
1898        # Redraw
1899        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
1900        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
1901
1902    def update_figure(self, title: str = None, retain_view: bool = True):
1903        if self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes:
1904            ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
1905        else:
1906            return
1907
1908        if type(self.time_vector) is np.ndarray and self.time_step:
1909            # Clear lines except the trace
1910            for line in ax.get_lines():
1911                    line.remove()
1912
1913            # Get xlim
1914            xlim = ax.get_xlim() if retain_view else (self.time_vector[0], self.time_vector[len(self.time_vector) - 1])
1915
1916            # Plot the trace
1917            if type(self.trace) is np.ndarray and self.figure_options['show']['trace'].get():
1918                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.trace, xlim), label='trace')
1919
1920            # Plot the calculation trace
1921            if type(self.calculation_trace) is np.ndarray and self.figure_options['show']['calculation_trace'].get():
1922                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.calculation_trace, xlim), label='calculation_trace')
1923
1924            # Plot the filtered trace
1925            if type(self.filtered_trace) is np.ndarray and self.figure_options['show']['filtered_trace'].get():
1926                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.filtered_trace, xlim), label='filtered_trace')
1927
1928            # Plot the baseline
1929            if type(self.baseline) is np.ndarray and self.figure_options['show']['baseline'].get():
1930                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.baseline, xlim), label='baseline')
1931
1932            # Plot the threshold
1933            if (type(self.pos_threshold) is np.ndarray and type(self.baseline) is np.ndarray and
1934                    self.figure_options['show']['threshold'].get()):
1935                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.pos_threshold, xlim), label='threshold')
1936                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.neg_threshold, xlim), label='threshold')
1937
1938            # Plot the events
1939            if type(self.event_coordinates) is np.ndarray and self.figure_options['show']['events'].get():
1940                ax.plot(*self.downsample_events(xlim), label='events', picker=True, pickradius=5)
1941
1942            # Set visibility, colour, linewidth and linestyle
1943            for line in ax.get_lines():
1944                if line.get_label() not in self.colours.keys():
1945                    continue
1946                line.set_color(self.figure_options['colour'][line.get_label()].get())
1947                line.set_linewidth(self.figure_options['linewidth'][line.get_label()].get())
1948                line.set_linestyle(self.figure_options['style'][line.get_label()].get())
1949                line.set_zorder(self.figure_options['zorder'][line.get_label()])
1950
1951        else:
1952            ax.clear()
1953
1954        # Set limits
1955        if not retain_view:
1956            ax.relim()
1957            ax.autoscale(True)
1958            self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].update()
1959            self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].push_current()
1960            self.update_slider()
1961
1962        # Set title
1963        if title:
1964            ax.set_title(title, fontsize=_LARGE_FONT)
1965
1966        # Set labels and grid
1967        ax.set_xlabel("Time (s)", fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
1968        ax.set_ylabel("Current" + f" (${self.trace_information['units'].get()}$)", fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
1969        ax.grid(self.figure_options['grid'].get())
1970        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].draw_idle()
1971        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].flush_events()
1972
1973    def update_figure_grid(self):
1974        grid = self.figure_options['grid'].get()
1975        self.figure_options['grid'].set(not grid)
1976        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0].grid(not grid)
1977        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
1978        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
1979
1980    def update_figure_show(self, key):
1981        # Check if the figure is initialised
1982        if self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes:
1983            ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
1984        else:
1985            return
1986
1987        # Check if time vector and time step are initialised
1988        if type(self.time_vector) is not np.ndarray or not self.time_step:
1989            return
1990
1991        show = self.figure_options['show'][key].get()
1992        if not show:
1993            lines = ax.get_lines()
1994            for line in lines:
1995                if key == line.get_label():
1996                    line.remove()
1997        else:
1998            xlim = ax.get_xlim()
1999            lines = []
2000            if key == 'trace' and type(self.trace) is np.ndarray:
2001                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.trace, xlim), label='trace'))
2002            elif key == 'calculation_trace' and type(self.calculation_trace) is np.ndarray:
2003                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.calculation_trace, xlim), label='calculation_trace'))
2004            elif key == 'filtered_trace' and type(self.filtered_trace) is np.ndarray:
2005                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.filtered_trace, xlim), label='filtered_trace'))
2006            elif key == 'baseline' and type(self.baseline) is np.ndarray:
2007                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.baseline, xlim), label='baseline'))
2008            elif key == 'threshold' and type(self.pos_threshold) is np.ndarray and type(self.baseline) is np.ndarray:
2009                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.pos_threshold, xlim), label='threshold'))
2010                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.neg_threshold, xlim), label='threshold'))
2011            elif key == 'events' and type(self.event_coordinates) is np.ndarray:
2012                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_events(xlim), label='events', picker=True, pickradius=5))
2013            # Set visibility, colour, linewidth and linestyle
2014            for line in lines:
2015                line = line[0]
2016                line.set_color(self.figure_options['colour'][line.get_label()].get())
2017                line.set_linewidth(self.figure_options['linewidth'][line.get_label()].get())
2018                line.set_linestyle(self.figure_options['style'][line.get_label()].get())
2019                line.set_zorder(self.figure_options['zorder'][line.get_label()])
2020        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2021        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()

2023    def update_figure_color(self, key):
2024        colour = colorchooser.askcolor(title="Choose color", initialcolor=self.figure_options['colour'][key].get())[1]
2025        if colour is None:
2026            return
2027
2028        self.figure_options['colour'][key].set(colour)
2029        self.style.configure(f'{key}_colour.TButton', background=colour)
2030        self.style.map(f'{key}_colour.TButton', background=[('active', colour)])
2031        self.widgets['analysis_view']['colour'][key].configure(style=f'{key}_colour.TButton')
2032
2033        if not self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes or not self.figure_options['show'][key].get():
2034            return
2035
2036        lines = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0].get_lines()
2037        for line in lines:
2038            if key == line.get_label():
2039                if colour == line.get_color():
2040                    continue
2041                line.set_color(colour)
2042        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2043        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()

2060        if self.after_id is not None:
2061            self.after_cancel(self.after_id)
2062
2063        self.after_id = self.after(50, self.update_figure_xlimits, limits)

2065    def update_figure_xlimits(self, limits = None):
2066        if limits:
2067            self.after_id = None
2068            ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
2069            ax.set_xlim(limits)
2070            # Downsample all lines
2071            self.downsample_all()
2072            if np.all(np.round(limits, 5) == np.round(ax.get_xlim(), 5)):
2073                # Push state to toolbar
2074                self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].push_current()
2075        else:
2076            mode = self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].mode
2077            if mode not in (mode.ZOOM, mode.PAN):
2078                return
2079            # Downsample all lines
2080            self.downsample_all()
2081        # Redraw
2082        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2083        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()

2106    def update_results(self):
2107        # Add the final tab
2108        tabs = []
2109        if 'Final' in self.analysis_results.keys():
2110            tabs.append(self.create_tab(self.analysis_results['Final'], 'Final'))
2111
2112        # Add the iteration tab
2113        if 'Iteration' in self.analysis_results.keys():
2114            tab = self.create_iteration_tab()
2115            if tab:
2116                tabs.append(tab)
2117
2118        # Add the estimate tab
2119        if 'Estimate' in self.analysis_results.keys():
2120            tabs.append(self.create_tab(self.analysis_results['Estimate'], 'Estimate'))
2121
2122        # Destroy the old, add the new
2123        for widget in self.widgets['results']['notebook'].winfo_children():
2124            if str(widget) in self.widgets['results']['notebook'].tabs():
2125                self.widgets['results']['notebook'].forget(widget)
2126                widget.destroy()
2127        for tab in tabs:
2128            self.widgets['results']['notebook'].add(tab[0], text=tab[1])
2129        # Feature window
2130        if self.widgets['results']['feature_window']:
2131            self.widgets['results']['feature_window'].destroy()
2132
2133        # Set the last called tab
2134        if self.widgets['results']['notebook'].tabs():
2135            for frame, title in tabs:
2136                if title == self.last_called:
2137                    self.widgets['results']['notebook'].select(frame)
2138                    break
2139            else:
2140                self.widgets['results']['notebook'].select(0)
2141            self.toggle_results('show')
2142        else:
2143            self.toggle_results('hide')
2144

2267    def create_tab(self, results, title):
2268        # Create tab and frames
2269        tab = ttk.Frame(self.widgets['results']['notebook'])
2270        header_separator = ttk.Separator(tab, style='primary.TSeparator')
2271        stats_frame = ttk.Frame(tab)
2272        event_frame = ttk.Frame(tab)
2273        footer_separator = ttk.Separator(tab, style='primary.TSeparator')
2274        feature_window_button = ttk.Button(
2275            tab,
2276            text="Feature Window",
2277            underline=0,
2278            command=self.create_feature_window,
2279            style='Small.secondary.Outline.TButton'
2280        )
2281        self.bind('<f>', lambda _: self.create_feature_window())
2282        tooltip.Hovertip(feature_window_button, 'F')
2283
2284        # Tab layout
2285        tab.columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
2286        header_separator.grid(row=0, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
2287        tab.rowconfigure(1, weight=1)
2288        stats_frame.grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="nsew")
2289        tab.rowconfigure(2, weight=5)
2290        event_frame.grid(row=2, column=0, sticky="nsew")
2291        feature_window_button.grid(row=3, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING, pady=_PADDING)
2292        footer_separator.grid(row=4, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
2293
2294        # Populate the main statistics
2295        main_stats = {**results.trace_stats, **results.event_stats}
2296        labels = []
2297        values = []
2298        seperators = []
2299        stats_frame.columnconfigure(0, weight=2)
2300        stats_frame.columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
2301        row = 0
2302        for i, stat in enumerate(main_stats):
2303            stats_frame.rowconfigure(row, weight=1)
2304            labels.append(ttk.Label(stats_frame, text=stat))
2305            labels[len(labels) - 1].grid(row=row, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING)
2306            values.append(ttk.Label(stats_frame, text=f'{main_stats[stat]:.6g}'))
2307            values[len(values) - 1].grid(row=row, column=1, sticky="e", padx=_PADDING)
2308            if i != len(main_stats) - 1:
2309                seperators.append(ttk.Separator(stats_frame))
2310                seperators[len(seperators) - 1].grid(row=row + 1, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
2311            row += 2
2312
2313        # Populate the event statistics
2314        event_stats = results.events.events
2315        if not event_stats:
2316            return tab, title
2317
2318        first_inner = next(iter(event_stats.values()))
2319        keys = list(first_inner.keys())
2320        table_stats = [{} for i in range(len(event_stats))]
2321        max_width = dict()
2322        # Format
2323        for key in keys:
2324            if key not in self.table_columns:
2325                continue
2326
2327            for i, stat in enumerate(event_stats.values()):
2328                if key == 'Coordinates':
2329                    table_stats[i][key] = f'({stat[key][0]}, {stat[key][1]})'
2330                else:
2331                    table_stats[i][key] = f'{np.round(stat[key], 2):g}'
2332
2333            row_width = max([len(stat[key]) for stat in table_stats]) + 2
2334            row_width *= self.fonts['small'].measure("0")
2335            heading_width = len(str(key)) + 2
2336            heading_width *= self.fonts['small_i'].measure("0")
2337            max_width[key] = row_width if row_width > heading_width else heading_width
2338        for i, stat in enumerate(event_stats.values()):
2339            table_stats[i]['Outlier'] = stat['Outlier']
2340
2341        # Event table
2342        tree = ttk.Treeview(
2343            event_frame,
2344            columns=[key for key in keys if key in self.table_columns],
2345            style='primary.Treeview',
2346            padding=0,
2347            show='headings',
2348        )
2349        # Tags for colours
2350        tree.tag_configure('outlier', background=self.colours['baseline'], foreground='white',
2351                           font=self.fonts['small'])
2352        tree.tag_configure('not_outlier', background='white', foreground=self.style.colors.secondary,
2353                           font=self.fonts['small'])
2354
2355        # Set the headings
2356        for key in keys:
2357            if key not in self.table_columns:
2358                continue
2359
2360            tree.heading(key, anchor='center', text=key, command=lambda _col=key:
2361                         self.sort_column(tree, _col, False))
2362            if key == 'ID':
2363                tree.column(key, width=max_width[key], anchor='w', stretch=1)
2364            else:
2365                tree.column(key, width=max_width[key], anchor='center', stretch=1)
2366
2367        # Populate the table
2368        for i in range(len(table_stats)):
2369            table_data = ()
2370            for key in table_stats[i].keys():
2371                if key not in self.table_columns:
2372                    continue
2373
2374                table_data += (table_stats[i][key],)
2375
2376            tree.insert("", tk.END, text=f'{i + 1}', values=table_data,
2377                        tags=('outlier' if table_stats[i]['Outlier'] else 'not_outlier'))
2378
2379        # Binds
2380        tree.bind("<Double-1>", partial(self.jump_to_event, title))
2381        tree.bind("<Return>", partial(self.jump_to_event, title))
2382        tree.bind("<space>", partial(self.jump_to_event, title))
2383        tree.bind("<Button-3>", partial(self.outlier_event, title))
2384        tree.bind("<Delete>", partial(self.outlier_event, title))
2385        tree.bind("<BackSpace>", partial(self.outlier_event, title))
2386
2387        # Scrollbar
2388        scrollbar = ttk.Scrollbar(event_frame, orient="vertical", command=tree.yview,
2389                                  style='secondary.Vertical.TScrollbar')
2390        tree.configure(yscrollcommand=scrollbar.set)
2391
2392        # Table layout
2393        event_frame.rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
2394        scrollbar.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="ns")
2395        event_frame.columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
2396        tree.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="nsew")
2397
2398        return tab, title

2400    def create_iteration_tab(self):
2401        if 'Iteration' in self.analysis_results.keys():
2402            trace_stats = self.analysis_results['Iteration']['trace_stats']
2403            event_stats = self.analysis_results['Iteration']['event_stats']
2404        else:
2405            return

2407            return
2408

2417        tab.rowconfigure(1, weight=1)

2419        footer_separator = ttk.Separator(tab, style='primary.TSeparator')
2420        footer_separator.grid(row=2, column=0, sticky="nsew")

2437                       path_effects=[pe.Stroke(linewidth=2, foreground='black'), pe.Normal()])
2438            ax.set_title(key, fontsize=_SMALL_FONT)
2439            ax.tick_params(axis='both', which='both', labelsize=_SMALL_FONT - 2)
2440            ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(MaxNLocator(integer=True))
2441        # Event stats

2443        for i, key in enumerate(event_stats[0].keys()):
2444            ax = fig.add_subplot(length, 1, i + 1 + len(trace_stats[0].keys()))
2445            ax.axvline(x=len(trace_stats), color=self.colours['baseline'], linestyle='--', linewidth=0.5)
2446            ax.plot(x, [stats[key] for stats in event_stats], label=key, color=self.colours['trace'],
2447                    linewidth=0.5, path_effects=[pe.Stroke(linewidth=1, foreground='black'), pe.Normal()])
2448            ax.scatter(x, [stats[key] for stats in event_stats], label=key, color=self.colours['threshold'],
2449                       path_effects=[pe.Stroke(linewidth=2, foreground='black'), pe.Normal()])
2450            ax.set_title(key, fontsize=_SMALL_FONT)
2451            ax.tick_params(axis='both', which='both', labelsize=_SMALL_FONT - 2)
2452            ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(MaxNLocator(integer=True))
2453        fig.supxlabel('Iteration', fontsize=_SMALL_FONT)
2454        # Margins and share x ticks

2492        toolbar_separator = ttk.Separator(graph_frame)

2494        canvas.get_tk_widget().pack(side=tk.TOP, fill=tk.BOTH, expand=1)

2500    def sort_column(self, tree, col, reverse):
2501        def check_column(value):
2502            try:
2503                return float(value[0])
2504            except:
2505                return float(eval(value[0])[0])
2506
2507        l = [(tree.set(k, col), k) for k in tree.get_children('')]
2508        l.sort(reverse=reverse, key=check_column)
2509
2510        for index, (val, k) in enumerate(l):
2511            tree.move(k, '', index)
2512
2513        tree.heading(col, command=lambda: self.sort_column(tree, col, not reverse))

2515    def outlier_event(self, title, event):
2516        # Get the event ID
2517        tree = event.widget
2518        if not tree.selection():
2519            return
2520
2521        events = self.analysis_results[title].events
2522        for item in tree.selection():
2523            event_id = int(tree.item(item, 'text'))
2524
2525            # Toggle the outlier flag
2526            if events.get(event_id)['Outlier']:
2527                events.get(event_id)['Outlier'] = False
2528                tree.item(item, tags='not_outlier')
2529            else:
2530                events.get(event_id)['Outlier'] = True
2531                tree.item(item, tags='outlier')
2532
2533        event_coordinates = []
2534        for event in events:
2535            if not event['Outlier']:
2536                event_coordinates.append(event['Coordinates'])
2537
2538        # Recalculate cutoff
2539        try:
2540            self.analysis_results[title].event_stats['Max Cutoff'] = np.round(
2541                nn.methods._calculate_cutoffs(
2542                    self.trace,
2543                    self.baseline,
2544                    self.initial_threshold,
2545                    np.asarray(event_coordinates, dtype=np.int64),
2546                    self.current_cutoff,
2547                    int(1 / self.time_step)
2548                )[0],
2549                2
2550            )
2551        except IndexError:
2552            self.analysis_results[title].event_stats['Max Cutoff'] = self.analysis_options['estimate_cutoff'].get()
2553
2554        self.analysis_options['cutoff'].set(self.analysis_results[title].event_stats['Max Cutoff'])
2555        self.flash_entry(self.widgets['analyse']['cutoff_input'])
2556
2557        # Update the feature window figure
2558        if self.widgets['results']['feature_window']:
2559            self.widgets['results']['feature_window'].update_all_figures()
2560
2561    def jump_to_event(self, title, event):
2562        # Get the event ID
2563        tree = event.widget
2564        if not tree.selection():
2565            return
2566        item = tree.selection()[0]
2567        event_id = int(tree.item(item, 'text'))
2568
2569        events = self.analysis_results[title].events
2570        # Get the event coordinates
2571        event_coordinates = events.get(event_id)['Coordinates']
2572        extra = (event_coordinates[1] - event_coordinates[0]) * 10
2573        start = event_coordinates[0] - extra if event_coordinates[0] - extra > 0 else 0
2574        end = event_coordinates[1] + extra if event_coordinates[1] + extra < len(self.trace) else len(self.trace) - 1
2575
2576        # Flash the event
2577        def remove():
2578            try:
2579                line[0].remove()
2580            except:
2581                return
2582            self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2583            self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
2584
2585        ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
2586        line = ax.plot(self.time_vector[event_coordinates[0]:event_coordinates[1] + 1],
2587                       self.trace[event_coordinates[0]:event_coordinates[1] + 1], 'r', linewidth=3, zorder=8)
2588        trace_min = np.min(self.trace[start:end])
2589        trace_max = np.max(self.trace[start:end])
2590        difference = 0.5 * abs(trace_max - trace_min)
2591        self.update_figure_xlimits((start * self.time_step + self.time_vector[0], end * self.time_step + self.time_vector[0]))
2592        ax.set(ylim=(trace_min - difference, trace_max + difference))
2593        self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].push_current()
2594        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2595        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
2596        self.after(500, remove)

2598    def pick_event(self, event):
2599        # Convert point to event coordinates
2600        point = np.round((event.artist.get_xdata()[event.ind[0]] - self.time_vector[0]) / self.time_step)
2601
2602        # Get currently shown events
2603        if 'Final' in self.analysis_results:
2604            events = self.analysis_results['Final'].events
2605            label = 'Final'
2606        else:
2607            events = self.analysis_results['Estimate'].events
2608            label = 'Estimate'
2609
2610        # Get the associated event
2611        event_id = None
2612        for event in events:
2613            coords = event['Coordinates']
2614            if coords[0] <= (point + 5) and coords[1] >= (point - 5):
2615                event_id = event['ID']
2616                break
2617
2618        if event_id is None:
2619            return
2620
2621        # Select the tab
2622        for i in self.widgets['results']['notebook'].tabs():
2623            if self.widgets['results']['notebook'].tab(i, "text") == label:
2624                self.widgets['results']['notebook'].select(i)
2625                break
2626
2627        # Get the treeview
2628        tab = self.widgets['results']['notebook'].nametowidget(self.widgets['results']['notebook'].select())
2629        tree = tab.winfo_children()[2].winfo_children()[0]
2630
2631        # Select the event
2632        for item in tree.get_children():
2633            if tree.item(item, 'text') == str(event_id):
2634                tree.selection_set(item)
2635                tree.focus(item)
2636                tree.see(item)
2637                dummy = tk.Event()
2638                dummy.widget = tree
2639                self.jump_to_event(label, dummy)
2640                break

2642    def validate_digits(self, event, contents, name):
2643        try:
2644            if event == 'focusout' and contents == '':
2645                self.analysis_options[name].set(self.analysis_options[name].get())
2646            if event == 'key' and contents == '':
2647                return True
2648
2649            float(contents)
2650            return True
2651        except:
2652            return False

2654    def flash_entry(self, entry):
2655        current = entry.cget('style')
2656
2657        self.style.configure(f'flash.{current}', bordercolor=self.style.colors.primary,
2658                             relief='raised', foreground=self.style.colors.primary)
2659        for i in np.arange(0, 10, 2):
2660            self.after(i * 250, lambda: entry.configure(style=f'flash.{current}'))
2661            self.after((i + 1) * 250, lambda: entry.configure(style=current))
2662        self.after(3000, lambda: entry.configure(style=current))

2664    def downsample_line(self, x, y, xlim, max_points=None):
2665        if max_points is None:
2666            max_points = int(self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].get_tk_widget().winfo_width())
2667            if max_points <= 1:
2668                max_points = int(self.width / 6 * 4)
2669
2670        # Mask to xlim support
2671        mask1 = np.searchsorted(x, xlim[0], 'left')
2672        mask2 = np.searchsorted(x, xlim[1], 'right')
2673        x_visible = x[mask1:mask2]
2674        y_visible = y[mask1:mask2]
2675        length = len(x_visible)
2676        if length <= max_points:
2677            return x_visible, y_visible
2678
2679        # Equally spaced bin edges
2680        starts, ends = _get_edges(length, max_points)
2681
2682        # Per bin min and max
2683        y_min = np.minimum.reduceat(y_visible, starts)
2684        y_max = np.maximum.reduceat(y_visible, starts)
2685
2686        # Allocate
2687        x_out = np.empty(2 * max_points, dtype=x_visible.dtype)
2688        y_out = np.empty(2 * max_points, dtype=y_visible.dtype)
2689
2690        # Fill the output arrays
2691        x_out[0::2] = x_visible[starts]
2692        x_out[1::2] = x_visible[ends - 1]
2693        y_out[0::2] = y_min
2694        y_out[1::2] = y_max
2695
2696        return x_out, y_out
2697
2698    def downsample_events(self, xlim):
2699        # Total width budget
2700        width = int(self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].get_tk_widget().winfo_width())
2701        if width <= 1:
2702            width = int(self.width / 6 * 4)
2703
2704        # Save lookups
2705        coords = np.asarray(self.event_coordinates, dtype=int)
2706        tv = self.time_vector
2707        tr = self.trace
2708
2709        # Mask to xlim support
2710        visible = coords[(tv[coords[:, 1]] >= xlim[0]) & (tv[coords[:, 0]] <= xlim[1])]
2711        if len(visible) == 0:
2712            return np.array([], dtype=object), np.array([], dtype=object)
2713
2714        # At least 2 pixels per segment
2715        per_seg = max(2, width // len(visible))
2716
2717        # Downsample each visible event
2718        x_out, y_out = [], []
2719        for start, end in visible:
2720            # Grab and clamp each segment
2721            seg_x = tv[start:end + 1]
2722            seg_y = tr[start:end + 1]
2723            mask = (seg_x >= xlim[0]) & (seg_x <= xlim[1])
2724            if not mask.any():
2725                continue
2726            seg_x = seg_x[mask]
2727            seg_y = seg_y[mask]
2728
2729            # Downsample this segment with its own budget
2730            xs, ys = self.downsample_line(
2731                seg_x, seg_y,
2732                xlim=(seg_x[0], seg_x[len(seg_x) - 1]),
2733                max_points=per_seg
2734            )
2735
2736            x_out.extend(xs)
2737            x_out.append(None)
2738            y_out.extend(ys)
2739            y_out.append(None)
2740
2741        return np.array(x_out, dtype=object), np.array(y_out, dtype=object)
2742
2743    def downsample_all(self):
2744        ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
2745        xlim = ax.get_xlim()
2746        thresh = 0
2747        for line in ax.get_lines():
2748            if line.get_label() not in self.colours.keys():
2749                continue
2750            if line.get_label() == 'threshold':
2751                if thresh == 0:
2752                    line.set_data(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.pos_threshold, xlim))
2753                else:
2754                    line.set_data(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.neg_threshold, xlim))
2755                thresh += 1
2756            elif line.get_label() == 'events':
2757                line.set_data(*self.downsample_events(xlim))
2758            else:
2759                line.set_data(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, getattr(self, line.get_label()), xlim))
2760

2764    def toolbar_wrapper(self, method):
2765        def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):
2766            method(*args, **kwargs)
2767            ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
2768            # Downsample
2769            self.downsample_all()
2770            # Redraw
2771            ax.figure.canvas.draw_idle()
2772            ax.figure.canvas.flush_events()
2773        return wrapper
