2775    def process_results(self, results):
2776        n = len(results.iterations)
2777        label = 'Final' if isinstance(results, IterateResults) else 'Estimate'
2778        self.last_called = label
2779        self.analysis_results[label] = results.iterations[n - 1]
2780        self.analysis_results[label].events = results.events
2781        self.analysis_results[label].events.label = label
2782        self.analysis_results[label].initial_threshold = results.initial_threshold
2783
2784        if isinstance(results, IterateResults):
2785            self.analysis_results['Iteration'] = dict(
2786                trace_stats=[res.trace_stats for res in results.iterations],
2787                event_stats=[res.event_stats for res in results.iterations])
2788            self.current_cutoff = self.analysis_options['cutoff'].get()
2789        else:
2790            self.analysis_results[label].trace_stats = results.iterations[0].trace_stats
2791            self.analysis_results[label].event_direction = results.event_direction
2792            self.current_cutoff = self.analysis_options['estimate_cutoff'].get()
2793
2794        self.initial_threshold = self.analysis_results[label].initial_threshold
2795        self.calculation_trace = self.analysis_results[label].calculation_trace
2796        self.baseline = self.analysis_results[label].baseline
2797        self.pos_threshold = self.analysis_results[label].baseline + self.analysis_results[label].threshold
2798        self.neg_threshold = self.analysis_results[label].baseline - self.analysis_results[label].threshold
2799        self.event_coordinates = self.analysis_results[label].event_coordinates
2800
2801        # Update the results window
2802        self.update_results()
2803        self.update()
2804        # Show the vectors
2805        self.update_figure(title=label)
2806
2807        # Update the direction for estimate only
2808        if label == 'Estimate':
2809            self.analysis_options['event_direction'].set(self.analysis_results[label].event_direction)
2810            self.flash_entry(self.widgets['analyse']['event_direction_input'])
2811
2812        # Update the cutoff
2813        self.analysis_options['cutoff'].set(np.round(self.analysis_results[label].event_stats['Max Cutoff'], 2))
2814        self.flash_entry(self.widgets['analyse']['cutoff_input'])
2815
2816    def load_trace(self):
2817        if self.flags['running']:
2818            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
2819            return
2820
2821        path = filedialog.askopenfilename(
2822            initialdir="/" if self.trace_information['path'].get() == ''
2823                           else os.path.split(self.trace_information['path'].get())[0],
2824            title="Choose a file",
2825            filetypes=(("All", "*.abf *.csv *.tsv *.txt *.dat"), ("ABF files", "*.abf"), ("CSV files", "*.csv"),
2826                       ("TSV files", "*.tsv"), ("Text files", "*.txt"), ("Data files", "*.dat"))
2827        )
2828        if path == '' or path is None:
2829            return
2830
2831        current_time = time.time()
2832        try:
2833            # Axon binary format
2834            if path.endswith('.abf'):
2835                data = pyabf.ABF(path)
2836                trace = data.sweepY.astype(float)
2837                time_vector = data.sweepX.astype(float)
2838                units = getattr(data, "sweepUnitsY", "pA")
2839            # Separated format
2840            elif path.endswith('.csv') or path.endswith('.tsv') or path.endswith('.txt') or path.endswith('.dat'):
2841                with open(path, newline='') as csvfile:
2842                    dialect = csv.Sniffer().sniff(csvfile.read(1024))
2843                    csvfile.seek(0)
2844                    reader = csv.reader(csvfile, dialect)
2845                    next(reader)
2846                    trace = []
2847                    time_vector = []
2848                    for row in reader:
2849                        trace.append(row[1])
2850                        time_vector.append(row[0])
2851                    trace = np.asarray(trace, dtype=float)
2852                    time_vector = np.asarray(time_vector, dtype=float)
2853                    units = 'pA'
2854            else:
2855                raise ValueError('File type not supported')
2856            time_step = time_vector[1] - time_vector[0]
2857        except Exception as e:
2858            messagebox.showerror('Error', f'Loading failed: {repr(e)}')
2859            return
2860        print(f'Loading time: {time.time() - current_time:.4f}')
2861
2862        self.reset_all()
2863        # Update the trace vectors
2864        self.trace = trace
2865        self.time_vector = time_vector
2866        self.time_step = time_step
2867        # Update the trace information
2868        self.trace_information['units'].set(units)
2869        # Show the trace information and trace vector
2870        self.update_load(path)
2871        # Initialise the slider
2872        self.init_slider()
2873        # Update the figure
2874        self.update_figure(title='Trace', retain_view=False)
2875        # Set the z-score
2876        self.analysis_options['z_score'].set(np.round(norm.ppf(1.0 - ((1.0 / len(self.trace)) / 2.0)), 3))
2877        self.default_analysis_options['z_score'] = self.analysis_options['z_score'].get()
2878        self.flash_entry(self.widgets['analyse']['z_score_input'])
2879        # Disable iterate options
2880        self.toggle_iterate_options(['disabled'])
2881        # Set the flag
2882        self.flags['loaded'] = True
2883
2884    def landing_load(self):
2885        self.load_trace()
2886
2887        if self.flags['loaded']:
2888            self.toggle_landing_page('hide')
2889
2890    def check_thread(self, thread, results, errors, current_time, title):
2891        self.flags['running'] = True
2892
2893        # Check for errors
2894        if not errors.empty():
2895            self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'].stop()
2896            self.flags['running'] = False
2897            messagebox.showerror('Error', f'{title} failed: {errors.get()}')
2898            return
2899
2900        # Reschedule check
2901        if thread.is_alive():
2902            self.after(100, lambda: self.check_thread(thread, results, errors, current_time, title))
2903            return
2904
2905        # Get results
2906        thread.join()
2907        self.update_idletasks()
2908        try:
2909            results = results.get_nowait()
2910        except queue.Empty:
2911            self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'].stop()
2912            self.flags['running'] = False
2913            messagebox.showerror('Error', f'{title} failed: No results returned')
2914            return
2915
2916        # Update analysis results
2917        print(f'{title} time: {time.time() - current_time:.4f}')
2918        self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'].stop()
2919        self.flags['running'] = False
2920        self.process_results(results)
2921        # Set the focus and flag
2922        if title == 'Estimate':
2923            self.widgets['analyse']['iterate'].focus_set()
2924            self.flags['estimated'] = True
2925            # Enable iterate options
2926            self.toggle_iterate_options(['!disabled'])
2927        else:
2928            self.widgets['results']['save'].focus_set()
2929            self.flags['iterated'] = True
2930
2931    def initial_estimate(self):
2932        if not self.flags['loaded']:
2933            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Trace not loaded')
2934            return
2935        if self.flags['running']:
2936            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
2937            return
2938
2939        current_time = time.time()
2940        self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'].start(10)
2941
2942        # Filter the trace
2943        self.filtered_trace = nn.methods._bounds_filter(self.trace, self.analysis_options['_bounds_filter'].get())
2944
2945        # Estimate the cutoff and direction
2946        def worker(results, errors,  *args):
2947            try:
2948                results.put(nn.initial_estimate(*args))
2949            except Exception as e:
2950                errors.put(str(e))
2951                return
2952
2953        # Run on a separate thread
2954        results = queue.Queue()
2955        errors = queue.Queue()
2956        thread = Thread(
2957            target=worker,
2958            args=(
2959                results,
2960                errors,
2961                self.trace,
2962                self.filtered_trace,
2963                int(1 / self.time_step),
2964                self.analysis_options['estimate_cutoff'].get(),
2965                self.analysis_options['replace_factor'].get(),
2966                self.analysis_options['replace_gap'].get(),
2967                self.analysis_options['threshold_window'].get(),
2968                self.analysis_options['z_score'].get(),
2969            ),
2970            daemon=True
2971        )
2972        thread.start()
2973        self.check_thread(thread, results, errors, current_time, 'Estimate')
2974
2975    def iterate(self):
2976        if not self.flags['loaded']:
2977            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Trace not loaded')
2978            return
2979        if self.flags['running']:
2980            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
2981            return
2982
2983        current_time = time.time()
2984        self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'].start(10)
2985
2986        # Filter the trace
2987        self.filtered_trace = nn.methods._bounds_filter(self.trace, self.analysis_options['_bounds_filter'].get())
2988
2989        # Iterate to find the final baseline and threshold
2990        def worker(results, errors, *args):
2991            try:
2992                if self.analysis_options['parallel'].get():
2993                    results.put(nn.parallel_iterate(*args))
2994                else:
2995                    results.put(nn.iterate(*args))
2996            except Exception as e:
2997                errors.put(str(e))
2998                return
2999
3000        # Run on a separate thread
3001        results = queue.Queue()
3002        errors = queue.Queue()
3003        thread = Thread(
3004            target=worker,
3005            args=(
3006                results,
3007                errors,
3008                self.trace,
3009                self.analysis_options['cutoff'].get(),
3010                self.analysis_options['event_direction'].get(),
3011                self.filtered_trace,
3012                int(1 / self.time_step),
3013                self.analysis_options['replace_factor'].get(),
3014                self.analysis_options['replace_gap'].get(),
3015                self.analysis_options['threshold_window'].get(),
3016                self.analysis_options['z_score'].get()
3017            ),
3018            daemon=True
3019        )
3020        thread.start()
3021        self.check_thread(thread, results, errors, current_time, 'Iteration')
3022
3023    def save_results(self):
3024        if not self.flags['iterated'] and not self.flags['estimated']:
3025            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'No results to save')
3026            return
3027        if self.flags['running']:
3028            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
3029            return
3030        if self.flags['iterated']:
3031            results = copy.deepcopy(self.analysis_results['Final'].events)
3032            label = 'final'
3033        else:
3034            results = copy.deepcopy(self.analysis_results['Estimate'].events)
3035            label = 'estimate'
3036        if not results:
3037            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'No results to save')
3038            return
3039
3040        # Save the results
3041        path = tk.filedialog.asksaveasfile(
3042            initialfile=basename(self.trace_information['path'].get()).split('.')[0] + f'_{label}.csv',
3043            defaultextension=".csv",
3044            initialdir=os.path.split(self.trace_information['path'].get())[0],
3045            title="Choose a location",
3046            filetypes=([("CSV files", "*.csv")])
3047        )
3048        if path == '' or path is None:
3049            return
3050
3051        # If you don't do this, DictWriter will ruin your life :( (** 2 bcos of excel cell size limit)
3052        units = self.trace_information['units'].get()
3053        amp_key = 'Amplitude (A)' if units == 'A' else f'Amplitude ({units[0]}A)'
3054        area_key = 'Area (C)' if units == 'A' else f'Area ({units[0]}C)'
3055        for event in results:
3056            packed = b"".join(struct.pack("d", num) for num in list(event.pop('Vector')))
3057            event['Vector (Base64)'] = base64.b64encode(packed).decode()
3058            event['Duration (ms)'] = event.pop('Duration')
3059            event['Max Cutoff (Hz)'] = event.pop('Max Cutoff')
3060            event[area_key] = event.pop('Area')
3061            event[amp_key] = event.pop('Amplitude')
3062
3063        fieldnames = [
3064            'ID',
3065            'Direction',
3066            amp_key,
3067            'Duration (ms)',
3068            area_key,
3069            'Max Cutoff (Hz)',
3070            'Coordinates',
3071            'Outlier',
3072            'Vector (Base64)',
3073        ]
3074
3075        with open(path.name, 'w', encoding='utf8', newline='') as path:
3076            w = csv.DictWriter(path, fieldnames)
3077            w.writeheader()
3078            w.writerows(results)
3079
3080        # Success
3081        messagebox.showinfo('Success', f'Saved {label} results')
3082
3083        # Set the flag
3084        self.flags['saved'] = True
class CustomFigureCanvas(matplotlib.backends.backend_tkagg.FigureCanvasTkAgg): 
64class CustomFigureCanvas(FigureCanvasTkAgg):
65    def __init__(self, figure, window, root):
66        super().__init__(figure, window)
67        self.root = root
68        self.after_id = None
69
70    def resize(self, event):
71        if self.after_id is not None:
72            self.root.after_cancel(self.after_id)
73        self.after_id = self.root.after(100, self.do_resize, event)
74
75    def do_resize(self, event):
76        self.after_id = None
77        super(CustomFigureCanvas, self).resize(event)

283    def create_options_tab(self, figure_config: dict, index: int = None):
284        label = figure_config['label']
285
286        # Tab widgets
287        self.widgets['options'][label] = dict()
288        widgets = self.widgets['options'][label]
289
290        # Tab frame and separator
291        widgets['frame'] = ttk.Frame(self.widgets['options']['notebook'])
292        widgets['header_separator'] = ttk.Separator(widgets['frame'], style='primary.TSeparator')
293        # Tab layout (column 0 is for labels, column 1 is for inputs)
294        widgets['frame'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1, uniform=label)
295        widgets['frame'].columnconfigure(1, weight=2, uniform=label)
296        widgets['header_separator'].grid(row=0, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
297        # Add tab
298        if index is None or index >= self.widgets['options']['notebook'].index('end'):
299            self.widgets['options']['notebook'].add(widgets['frame'], text=label)
300        else:
301            self.widgets['options']['notebook'].insert(index, widgets['frame'], text=label)
302
303        # Plot and axis options
304        self.plot_options[label] = dict()
305        self.axis_options[label] = dict()
306        self.axis_func_options[label] = dict()
307        self.feature_filters[label] = dict()
308        opt_length = (len(figure_config['axis_options']) + len(figure_config['plot_options']) +
309                      len(figure_config['axis_func_options']) + len(figure_config['feature_filters']))
310
311        i = 1
312        for tk_var, options in [(self.plot_options[label], figure_config['plot_options']),
313                                (self.axis_options[label], figure_config['axis_options']),
314                                (self.axis_func_options[label], figure_config['axis_func_options']),
315                                (self.feature_filters[label], figure_config['feature_filters'])]:
316            for opt in options.keys():
317                # Tk variables
318                if options[opt]['type'] in ['str', 'colour', 'feature']:
319                    tk_var[opt] = tk.StringVar()
320                elif options[opt]['type'] == 'int':
321                    tk_var[opt] = tk.IntVar()
322                elif options[opt]['type'] == 'float':
323                    tk_var[opt] = tk.DoubleVar()
324                elif options[opt]['type'] == 'bool':
325                    tk_var[opt] = tk.BooleanVar()
326
327                # Default
328                tk_var[opt].set(options[opt]['default'])
329
330                # Label
331                widgets['frame'].rowconfigure(i, weight=1, uniform=label)
332                widgets[opt + '_label'] = ttk.Label(widgets['frame'], text=options[opt]['label'])
333                widgets[opt + '_label'].grid(row=i, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING)
334
335                # Entry
336                if options[opt]['type'] in ['str', 'feature']:
337                    widgets[opt] = ttk.Combobox(
338                        widgets['frame'],
339                        textvariable=tk_var[opt],
340                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH,
341                        justify='center',
342                        values=options[opt]['values'],
343                        state='readonly'
344                    )
345                    widgets[opt].bind("<<ComboboxSelected>>", lambda _, x = options[opt]['relim']: (
346                                                                self.update_figure(figure_config, relim=x)))
347                    widgets[opt].grid(row=i, column=1, sticky="e", padx=_PADDING)
348                    widgets[opt].configure(font=self.master.fonts['small'])
349                elif options[opt]['type'] in ['int', 'float']:
350                    widgets[opt] = ttk.Spinbox(
351                        widgets['frame'],
352                        textvariable=tk_var[opt],
353                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH,
354                        justify='center',
355                        from_=options[opt]['values'][0],
356                        to=options[opt]['values'][1],
357                        increment=options[opt]['values'][2],
358                        command=partial(self.update_figure, figure_config, relim=options[opt]['relim'])
359                    )
360                    widgets[opt].grid(row=i, column=1, sticky="e", padx=_PADDING)
361                    widgets[opt].configure(font=self.master.fonts['small'])
362                elif options[opt]['type'] == 'bool':
363                    widgets[opt] = ttk.Checkbutton(
364                        widgets['frame'],
365                        variable=tk_var[opt],
366                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH - 5,
367                        onvalue=True,
368                        offvalue=False,
369                        command=partial(self.update_figure, figure_config, relim=options[opt]['relim']),
370                        style='Roundtoggle.Toolbutton'
371                    )
372                    widgets[opt].grid(row=i, column=1, sticky="e", padx=_PADDING)
373                elif options[opt]['type'] == 'colour':
374                    widgets[opt] = ttk.Button(
375                        widgets['frame'],
376                        command=partial(self.update_colour, figure_config, opt),
377                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH - 3
378                    )
379                    self.master.style.configure(
380                        f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{opt}_colour.TButton', background=tk_var[opt].get(), borderwidth=0)
381                    self.master.style.map(f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{opt}_colour.TButton',
382                                          background=[('active', tk_var[opt].get())])
383                    widgets[opt].configure(style=f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{opt}_colour.TButton')
384                    widgets[opt].grid(row=i, column=1, sticky="e", padx=_PADDING, pady=6)
385
386                # Separator
387                if i < (2 * opt_length) - 1:
388                    widgets[opt + '_separator'] = ttk.Separator(widgets['frame'], orient='horizontal')
389                    widgets[opt + '_separator'].grid(row=i + 1, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
390
391                i += 2
392
393        # Add config button
394        widgets['config_button'] = ttk.Button(widgets['frame'], text="Edit Configuration", underline=0,
395                                              command=partial(self.create_edit_window, figure_config),
396                                              style='secondary.Outline.TButton')
397        self.bind('<Control-a>', lambda _: partial(self.create_edit_window, figure_config))
398        widgets['config_button'].grid(row=i, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew", pady=(0, _PADDING), padx=_PADDING)

400    def create_figure_frame(self, figure_config: dict):
401        label = figure_config['label']
402        sub_plot_init = figure_config['sub_plot_init']
403
404        # Figure frame widgets
405        self.widgets['feature_view'][label] = dict()
406        widgets = self.widgets['feature_view'][label]
407
408
409        widgets['frame'] = ttk.Frame(self.windows['feature_view_internal'])
410        # configure layout (do not place frame in grid as this is done dynamically)
411        self.windows['feature_view_internal'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
412        self.windows['feature_view_internal'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
413        # Figure and canvas
414        widgets['fig'] = Figure(layout='constrained', figsize=(1, 1))
415        widgets['canvas'] = FigureCanvasTkAgg(widgets['fig'], widgets['frame'])
416        widgets['canvas'].draw()
417        # Toolbar
418        widgets['toolbar'] = NavigationToolbar2Tk(widgets['canvas'], widgets['frame'], pack_toolbar=False)
419        for child in widgets['toolbar'].winfo_children():
420            child.pack_forget()
421            child.configure(background='white', border=1)
422        for child in widgets['toolbar'].winfo_children():
423            if child != widgets['toolbar'].children['!button4']:
424                child.pack(side=tk.LEFT)
425        widgets['toolbar'].update()
426        # Toolbar separator
427        widgets['toolbar_separator'] = ttk.Separator(widgets['frame'])
428        # Frame layout
429        widgets['frame'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
430        widgets['frame'].rowconfigure(2, weight=1)
431        widgets['toolbar'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky='nsew', padx=_PADDING)
432        widgets['toolbar_separator'].grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="nsew")
433        widgets['canvas'].get_tk_widget().grid(row=2, column=0, sticky='nsew', padx=2 * _PADDING, pady=2 * _PADDING)
434
435        # Feature view
436        widgets['fig'].add_subplot(111, **sub_plot_init)
437
438        # Bind events
439        widgets['canvas'].mpl_connect("pick_event", self.pick_event)

441    def update_colour(self, figure_config: dict, option: str):
442        label = figure_config['label']
443        plot_options = self.plot_options[label]
444        widgets = self.widgets['options'][label]
445
446        colour = colorchooser.askcolor(title="Choose color", initialcolor=plot_options[option].get())[1]
447        if colour is None:
448            return
449
450        plot_options[option].set(colour)
451        self.master.style.configure(
452            f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{option}_colour.TButton', background=plot_options[option].get(),)
453        self.master.style.map(f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{option}_colour.TButton',
454                              background=[('active', plot_options[option].get())])
455        widgets[option].configure(style=f'{label.replace(" ", "")}_{option}_colour.TButton')
456
457        self.update_figure(figure_config)

459    def update_figure(self, figure_config: dict, relim: bool = False):
460        label = figure_config['label']
461        function = figure_config['function']
462        plot_init = figure_config['plot_init']
463        plot_options = figure_config['plot_options']
464        axis_init = figure_config['axis_init']
465        axis_options = figure_config['axis_options']
466        axis_func_init = figure_config['axis_func_init']
467        axis_func_options = figure_config['axis_func_options']
468
469        # Get and clear axis
470        ax = self.widgets['feature_view'][label]['fig'].axes[0]
471        view_limits = (ax.get_xlim(), ax.get_ylim())
472
473        try:
474            ax.clear()
475
476            # Get the filtered event IDs
477            event_ids = self.get_filtered_ids(figure_config)
478
479            # Get figure options
480            options = dict()
481            current_features = []
482            for option in plot_options.keys():
483                if plot_options[option]['type'] == 'feature':
484                    options[option] = self.events.get_feature(self.plot_options[label][option].get(), event_ids)
485                    current_features.append(self.plot_options[label][option].get())
486                else:
487                    options[option] = self.plot_options[label][option].get()
488
489            # Plot
490            plot = getattr(ax, function)(**options, **plot_init, picker=True)
491
492            # Get axis options
493            options = dict()
494            for option in axis_options.keys():
495                options[option] = self.axis_options[label][option].get()
496
497            # Set axis options
498            ax.set(**options, **axis_init, label=str(current_features))
499
500            # Title
501            if 'title' not in axis_init.keys():
502                ax.set_title(self.events.label, fontsize=_LARGE_FONT)
503            # Labels
504            if 'xlabel' not in axis_init.keys():
505                ax.set_xlabel(current_features[0], fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
506            if 'ylabel' not in axis_init.keys() and len(current_features) > 1:
507                ax.set_ylabel(current_features[1], fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
508            if 'zlabel' not in axis_init.keys() and len(current_features) > 2:
509                ax.set_zlabel(current_features[2], rotation=90, fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
510
511            # Set default axis func options
512            for option in axis_func_init.keys():
513                getattr(ax, option)(**axis_func_init[option])
514
515            # Set axis func options
516            for option in axis_func_options.keys():
517                getattr(ax, option)(self.axis_func_options[label][option].get(),
518                                    **axis_func_options[option].get('kwargs', {}))
519
520
521            # Update data limits
522            if relim:
523                try:
524                    ax.ignore_existing_data_limits = True
525                    ax.update_datalim(plot.get_datalim(ax.transData))
526                except AttributeError:
527                    ax.relim()
528                ax.autoscale(True)
529                self.widgets['feature_view'][label]['toolbar'].update()
530                self.widgets['feature_view'][label]['toolbar'].push_current()
531            else:
532                ax.set_xlim(view_limits[0])
533                ax.set_ylim(view_limits[1])
534
535            # Draw
536            self.widgets['feature_view'][label]['canvas'].draw_idle()
537            self.widgets['feature_view'][label]['canvas'].flush_events()
538
539        except Exception:
540            ax.set_xlim(view_limits[0])
541            ax.set_ylim(view_limits[1])
542            return
543
544    def update_current_figure(self, relim: bool = False):
545        config = self.figure_configs[self.current_figure]
546        self.update_figure(config, relim)
547
548    def update_all_figures(self, relim: bool = False):
549        for config in self.figure_configs:
550            self.update_figure(config, relim)

552    def create_edit_window(self, figure_config: dict):

554        self.windows['edit_config']['windows'] = dict()

609                                           command=partial(self.edit_figure_config, figure_config),
610                                           style='secondary.Outline.TButton')

617        widgets['entry'].insert(tk.END, dumps(figure_config, indent=4))

619    def edit_figure_config(self, figure_config: dict):
620        # Get the new config
621        config = self.windows['edit_config']['widgets']['entry'].get('1.0', 'end')
622
623        # Replace 'features' with the features
624        config = config.replace('features', str(self.features))
625        for i in range(100):
626            if f'features[{i}]' in config:
627                config = config.replace(f'features[{i}]', f'"{self.features[i]}"')
628
629        # Convert the config back to a dictionary
630        try:
631            config = loads(config)
632        except JSONDecodeError:
633            messagebox.showerror("Error", "Invalid JSON configuration")
634            return
635
636        # Parse the config
637        try:
638            config = self.parse_figure_config(config)
639        except ValueError as e:
640            messagebox.showerror("Error", e)
641            return
642
643        # Replace the old config
644        current_config = self.get_figure_config(figure_config['label'])
645        current_config.update(config)
646        # Get the tab index
647        index = self.widgets['options']['notebook'].index(self.widgets['options'][figure_config['label']]['frame'])
648        # Remove the old figure and tab
649        self.remove_figure_config(current_config)
650
651        # Add figure frame
652        self.create_figure_frame(figure_config)
653        # Add options tab
654        self.create_options_tab(figure_config, index)
655        self.set_current_tab(figure_config['label'])
656        # Update the figure
657        self.update_figure(figure_config, relim=True)
658
659        # Destroy the window
660        self.windows['edit_config']['windows']['top_level'].destroy()
661
662    def add_figure_config(self, figure_config: dict):
663        # Parse the figure configuration
664        if figure_config['label'] in [config['label'] for config in self.figure_configs]:
665            messagebox.showerror("Error", "label already exists in figure configurations")
666            return
667        try:
668            figure_config = self.parse_figure_config(figure_config)
669        except ValueError as e:
670            messagebox.showerror("Error", e)
671            return
672
673        # Add to the list of figures and configs
674        self.figure_configs.append(figure_config)
675        # Add figure frame
676        self.create_figure_frame(figure_config)
677        # Add options tab
678        self.create_options_tab(figure_config)
679        # Update the figure
680        self.update_figure(figure_config, relim=True)
681
682    def remove_figure_config(self, figure_config: dict):
683        # Remove the figure frame
684        self.widgets['feature_view'][figure_config['label']]['frame'].destroy()
685        # Remove the options tab
686        self.widgets['options'][figure_config['label']]['frame'].destroy()
687        # Update the current figure
688        self.current_figure = None
689        self.set_current_figure()
690
691    @staticmethod
692    def parse_figure_config(figure_config: dict):
693        # Label
694        if not 'label' in figure_config.keys():
695            raise ValueError("label not found in figure configuration")
696        if type(figure_config['label']) != str:
697            raise ValueError("label must be a string")
698
699        # Function
700        if not 'function' in figure_config.keys():
701            raise ValueError("function not found in figure configuration")
702        if type(figure_config['function']) != str:
703            raise ValueError("function must be a string")
704        if not hasattr(Axes, figure_config['function']):
705            raise ValueError("function not found in matplotlib Axes")
706
707        # Optional config keys
708        for key in ['sub_plot_init', 'axis_init', 'axis_func_init', 'plot_init', 'axis_options', 'axis_func_options',
709                    'plot_options', 'feature_filters']:
710            if not key in figure_config.keys() or figure_config[key] is None:
711                figure_config[key] = {}
712            if type(figure_config[key]) != dict:
713                raise ValueError(f"{key} must be a dictionary")
714
715        # Options keys
716        for key in ['axis_options', 'axis_func_options', 'plot_options', 'feature_filters']:
717            for subkey in figure_config[key].keys():
718                if type(figure_config[key][subkey]) != dict:
719                    raise ValueError(f"{subkey} in {key} must be a dictionary")
720                if not 'label' in figure_config[key][subkey].keys():
721                    raise ValueError("{subkey} in {key} must have a label")
722                if not 'relim' in figure_config[key][subkey].keys():
723                    raise ValueError("{subkey} in {key} must have a relim option")
724                if not 'type' in figure_config[key][subkey].keys():
725                    raise ValueError("{subkey} in {key} must have a type option")
726                if not 'default' in figure_config[key][subkey].keys():
727                    raise ValueError("{subkey} in {key} must have a default option")
728
729        # Plot options
730        if not len(figure_config['plot_options']):
731            raise ValueError("plot_options cannot be empty")
732
733        # Axis functions
734        for key in ['axis_func_init', 'axis_func_options']:
735            for subkey in figure_config[key].keys():
736                if not hasattr(Axes, subkey):
737                    raise ValueError(f"{subkey} not found in matplotlib Axes")
738
739        return figure_config
740
741    def get_filtered_ids(self, figure_config: dict):
742        label = figure_config['label']
743        feature_filters = figure_config['feature_filters']
744
745        # Get feature filters
746        filters = [(key, self.feature_filters[label][key].get()) for key in feature_filters.keys()]
747        # Remove 'all' values
748        items = []
749        for key, value in filters:
750            if value == 'all':
751                continue
752            if value == True and feature_filters[key].get('onvalue') == 'all':
753                continue
754            if value == False and feature_filters[key].get('offvalue') == 'all':
755                continue
756            items.append((key, value))
757
758        event_ids = []
759        # Get event IDs that match the filters
760        for event in self.events:
761            if not all([event[key] == value for key, value in items]):
762                continue
763            else:
764                event_ids.append(event['ID'])
765
766        return event_ids
767
768    def get_figure_config(self, label: str):
769        for config in self.figure_configs:
770            if config['label'] == label:
771                return config
772
773    def set_current_tab(self, label: str):
774        for i in self.widgets['options']['notebook'].tabs():
775            if self.widgets['options']['notebook'].tab(i, "text") == label:
776                self.widgets['options']['notebook'].select(i)
777                break

779    def set_current_figure(self):
780        # Hide the previous plot
781        if self.current_figure:
782            self.widgets['feature_view'][self.current_figure]['frame'].grid_forget()
783        # Currently selected tab
784        tab_id = self.widgets['options']['notebook'].select()
785        self.current_figure = self.widgets['options']['notebook'].tab(tab_id, "text")
786        # Show the new plot
787        self.widgets['feature_view'][self.current_figure]['frame'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")

789    def pick_event(self, event):
790        point = []
791        if isinstance(event.artist, Line2D):
792            point = [event.artist.get_xdata()[event.ind[0]], event.artist.get_ydata()[event.ind[0]]]
793        elif isinstance(event.artist, Path3DCollection):
794            point = [event.artist._offsets3d[0][event.ind[0]], event.artist._offsets3d[1][event.ind[0]],
795                     event.artist._offsets3d[2][event.ind[0]]]
796        elif isinstance(event.artist, PathCollection):
797            point = [event.artist.get_offsets()[event.ind[0]][0], event.artist.get_offsets()[event.ind[0]][1]]
798        elif isinstance(event.artist, Rectangle):
799            point = [event.artist.get_x()]
800
801        feature_names = literal_eval(event.canvas.figure.axes[0].get_label())
802
803        if len(feature_names) != len(point):
804            return
805
806        event_id = None
807        for e in self.events:
808            if all([point[i] == e[feature_names[i]] for i in range(len(feature_names))]):
809                event_id = e['ID']
810                break
811
812        if event_id is None:
813            return
814
815        # Get currently shown events
816        label = self.events.label
817
818        # Select the tab
819        for i in self.master.widgets['results']['notebook'].tabs():
820            if self.master.widgets['results']['notebook'].tab(i, "text") == label:
821                self.master.widgets['results']['notebook'].select(i)
822                break
823
824        # Get the treeview
825        tab = self.master.widgets['results']['notebook'].nametowidget(
826            self.master.widgets['results']['notebook'].select())
827        tree = tab.winfo_children()[2].winfo_children()[0]
828
829        # Select the event
830        for item in tree.get_children():
831            if tree.item(item, 'text') == str(event_id):
832                tree.selection_set(item)
833                tree.focus(item)
834                tree.see(item)
835                dummy = tk.Event()
836                dummy.widget = tree
837                self.master.jump_to_event(label, dummy)
838                break

Toplevel widget, e.g. for dialogs.

FeatureWindow(master, events)

1467    def init_analysis_view(self):
1468        self.widgets['analysis_view'] = dict()
1469        # Analysis view title
1470        self.widgets['analysis_view']['title'] = ttk.Label(self.windows['analysis_view'], text="Analysis View",
1471                                                           style='primary.Inverse.TLabel', anchor='center')
1472        # Internal frame for figure
1473        self.windows['analysis_view_figure'] = ttk.Frame(self.windows['analysis_view'])
1474        # Layout
1475        self.windows['analysis_view'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
1476        self.widgets['analysis_view']['title'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew", pady=(_WINDOW_PADDING, 0))
1477        self.windows['analysis_view'].rowconfigure(1, weight=3)
1478        self.windows['analysis_view_figure'].grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_WINDOW_PADDING,
1479                                                  pady=_WINDOW_PADDING)
1480
1481        # Create figure, axis and canvas
1482        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'] = Figure(layout='constrained')
1483        ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].add_subplot(111)
1484        ax.set_xlabel("Time ($s$)", fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
1485        ax.set_ylabel("Current" + f" (${self.trace_information['units'].get()}$)", fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
1486        # Create canvas
1487        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'] = CustomFigureCanvas(self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'],
1488                                                                    self.windows['analysis_view_figure'], self)
1489        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].draw()
1490        # Create toolbar
1491        self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'] = NavigationToolbar2Tk(self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'],
1492                                                                        self.windows['analysis_view_figure'],
1493                                                                        pack_toolbar=False)
1494        for child in self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].winfo_children():
1495            child.pack_forget()
1496            child.configure(background='white', border=1)
1497        for child in self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].winfo_children():
1498            if child != self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].children['!button4']:
1499                child.pack(side=tk.LEFT)
1500        # Reconfigure commands to downsample
1501        for name in ('Home', 'Back', 'Forward'):
1502            command = getattr(self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'], name.lower())
1503            btn = self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar']._buttons[name]
1504            btn.configure(command=self.toolbar_wrapper(command))
1505        self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].update()
1506
1507        # Progress bar
1508        self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'] = Floodgauge(
1509            self.windows['analysis_view_figure'],
1510            orient=tk.HORIZONTAL,
1511            mode='indeterminate',
1512            length=180,
1513            style='Horizontal.TFloodgauge'
1514        )
1515        # Toolbar separator
1516        self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar_separator'] = ttk.Separator(self.windows['analysis_view_figure'])
1517
1518        # Figure frame layout
1519        self.windows['analysis_view_figure'].columnconfigure(0, weight=2)
1520        self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING)
1521        self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'].grid(row=0, column=1, sticky='nse', padx=_PADDING, pady=_PADDING)
1522        self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar_separator'].grid(row=1, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
1523        self.windows['analysis_view_figure'].rowconfigure(2, weight=1)
1524        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].get_tk_widget().grid(row=2, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew",
1525                                                                     padx=_PADDING, pady=(_PADDING, 0))
1526
1527        # Slider figure frame
1528        self.windows['analysis_view_slider'] = ttk.Frame(self.windows['analysis_view_figure'])
1529        self.windows['analysis_view_slider'].grid(row=3, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING,
1530                                                  pady=(0, _PADDING))
1531        # Create figure, axis and canvas
1532        self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider_fig'] = Figure(figsize=(50, 0.25))
1533        ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider_fig'].add_subplot(111)
1534        self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider_fig'].subplots_adjust(
1535            left=0.02,
1536            right=0.98,
1537            top=1,
1538            bottom=0,
1539            wspace=0,
1540            hspace=0
1541        )
1542        # Create canvas
1543        self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider_canvas'] = FigureCanvasTkAgg(self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider_fig'],
1544                                                                           self.windows['analysis_view_slider'])
1545        self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider_canvas'].draw()
1546        # Add the range slider
1547        handles = dict(facecolor='white', edgecolor=self.style.colors.secondary, size=10)
1548        self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider'] = RangeSlider(
1549            ax,'',0.0,1.0, closedmax=False, closedmin=False,
1550          facecolor=self.style.colors.primary, handle_style=handles)
1551        self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider'].valtext.set_visible(False)
1552        self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider'].on_changed(self.schedule_update_figure_xlimits)
1553        # Layout
1554        self.windows['analysis_view_slider'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
1555        self.windows['analysis_view_slider'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
1556        self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider_canvas'].get_tk_widget().grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")
1557
1558        # Bind events
1559        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].mpl_connect("key_press_event",
1560                                                            partial(self.toolbar_key_press, 'analysis_view'))
1561        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].mpl_connect("draw_event", lambda _: self.after(100, self.update_slider))
1562        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].mpl_connect("button_release_event", lambda _: self.update_figure_xlimits())
1563        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].mpl_connect("pick_event", self.pick_event)
1564
1565    def init_slider(self):
1566        if type(self.time_vector) is not np.ndarray:
1567            return
1568
1569        limits = (self.time_vector[0], self.time_vector[len(self.time_vector) - 1])
1570        padding = (limits[1] - limits[0]) / 20
1571        limits = (limits[0] - padding, limits[1] + padding)
1572        slider = self.widgets['analysis_view']['slider']
1573        slider.eventson = False
1574        slider.valmin = limits[0]
1575        slider.valmax = limits[1]
1576        slider.valinit = limits
1577        slider.valstep = self.time_step
1578        slider.set_val(limits)
1579        slider.ax.set_xlim(limits)
1580        slider.eventson = True
1581

1586            text="Options",
1587            underline=0,
1588            command=self.toggle_analysis_view_options,
1589            style='primary.TButton'
1590        )

1596        self.windows['analysis_view_options'].grid(row=3, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_WINDOW_PADDING,
1597                                                   pady=(0, _WINDOW_PADDING))
1598
1599        # Reset labelframe
1600        self.widgets['analysis_view']['reset'] = ttk.LabelFrame(self.windows['analysis_view_options'], text="Reset",
1601                                                                style='secondary.TLabelframe', labelanchor='n')
1602        # Lines labelframe
1603        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'] = ttk.LabelFrame(self.windows['analysis_view_options'], text="Lines",
1604                                                                style='secondary.TLabelframe', labelanchor='n')

1608        self.windows['analysis_view_options'].columnconfigure(1, weight=4)

1614                 ('results', self.reset_results)]

1618                self.widgets['analysis_view']['reset'],

1629                ('calculation_trace', 'Calculation Trace'), ('filtered_trace', 'Filtered Trace'), ('events', 'Events')]

1631                   ('colour', 'colour', self.update_figure_color), ('style', 'str', self.update_figure_style)]

1634                                             events=7)

1637        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'].rowconfigure(0, weight=1, uniform='options')
1638        for i, option in enumerate(options):

1645                                                                            text=option[0].capitalize(), anchor='center')

1650        self.widgets['analysis_view']['heading_separator'].grid(row=1, column=0, columnspan=len(options) + 1,
1651                                                                sticky="nsew")
1652
1653        # Initialise the rows
1654        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'].columnconfigure(0, weight=1, uniform='options')
1655        i = 2

1657            self.widgets['analysis_view'][f'{key[0]}_label'] = ttk.Label(self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1658                                                                      text=key[1])
1659            self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'].rowconfigure(i, weight=1, uniform='options')
1660            self.widgets['analysis_view'][f'{key[0]}_label'].grid(row=i, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING)
1661            if i < (2 * len(keys)) + 1:
1662                self.widgets['analysis_view'][f'{key[0]}_separator'] = ttk.Separator(self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'])
1663                self.widgets['analysis_view'][f'{key[0]}_separator'].grid(row=i + 1, column=0,
1664                                                                          columnspan=len(options) + 1, sticky="nsew")
1665            # Options for each key

1672                        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1673                        variable=self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]],

1678                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]] = tk.DoubleVar()
1679                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]] = ttk.Spinbox(
1680                        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1681                        textvariable=self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]],
1682                        format='%2.1f',
1683                        command=partial(option[2], key[0]),

1685                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH
1686                    )
1687                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].bind("<Return>", lambda _: partial(option[2], key[0]))
1688                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].bind("<FocusOut>", lambda _: partial(option[2], key[0]))
1689                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].configure(font=self.fonts['small'])
1690                elif option[1] == 'colour':
1691                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]] = tk.StringVar()
1692                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]] = ttk.Button(
1693                        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1694                        command=partial(option[2],key[0]),
1695                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH - 3,
1696                    )
1697                elif option[1] == 'str':
1698                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]] = tk.StringVar()
1699                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]] = ttk.Combobox(
1700                        self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1701                        textvariable=self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]],
1702                        state='readonly',
1703                        justify='center',
1704                        width=_ENTRY_WIDTH
1705                    )
1706                    self.widgets['analysis_view']['style'][key[0]].bind('<<ComboboxSelected>>', lambda _, x = key[0]:
1707                                                                        option[2](x))
1708                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].configure(font=self.fonts['small'])
1709
1710                # Specific configuration
1711                if option[0] == 'show':
1712                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]].set(True if key[0] in ['trace', 'baseline', 'threshold'] else
1713                                                               False)
1714                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].grid(row=i, column=j, padx=(_PADDING + 3, _PADDING),
1715                                                                          pady=(1, 0))
1716                elif option[0] == 'linewidth':
1717                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]].set(1.0)
1718                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].configure(from_=0, to=4, increment=0.1)
1719                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].grid(row=i, column=j, padx=_PADDING)
1720                elif option[0] == 'colour':
1721                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]].set(self.colours[key[0]])
1722                    self.style.configure(f'{key[0]}_colour.TButton', background=self.colours[key[0]],
1723                                         borderwidth=0)
1724                    self.style.map(f'{key[0]}_colour.TButton', background=[('active', self.colours[key[0]])])
1725                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].configure(style=f'{key[0]}_colour.TButton')
1726                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].grid(row=i, column=j, padx=_PADDING)
1727                elif option[0] == 'style':
1728                    self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]].set('-')
1729                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].configure(values=['-', '--', ':', '-.'])
1730                    self.widgets['analysis_view'][option[0]][key[0]].grid(row=i, column=j, padx=_PADDING)
1731
1732
1733                self.default_figure_options[option[0]][key[0]] = self.figure_options[option[0]][key[0]].get()
1734                j += 1
1735
1736            i += 2
1737
1738        # Add grid to the top left corner
1739        self.figure_options['grid'] = tk.BooleanVar(value=False)
1740        self.default_figure_options['grid'] = self.figure_options['grid'].get()
1741        self.widgets['analysis_view']['grid'] = ttk.Button(
1742            self.widgets['analysis_view']['lines'],
1743            text='Grid',
1744            width=_ENTRY_WIDTH,
1745            command=self.update_figure_grid,
1746            style='Small.secondary.Outline.TButton',
1747        )
1748        self.widgets['analysis_view']['grid'].grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nw", padx=_PADDING + 2)

1783    def reset_load(self):
1784        if self.flags['running']:
1785            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
1786            return
1787
1788        # Reset the trace vectors
1789        self.trace = None
1790        self.time_vector = None
1791        self.time_step = None
1792        # Clear the trace information
1793        for key in self.trace_information:
1794            self.trace_information[key].set('')
1795        self.trace_information['units'].set('pA')
1796        # Set the flags
1797        self.flags['loaded'] = False
1798
1799    def reset_algorithm(self):
1800        for key in self.default_analysis_options:
1801            self.analysis_options[key].set(self.default_analysis_options[key])
1802        # Disable iterate options
1803        self.toggle_iterate_options(['disabled'])
1804
1805    def reset_figure(self):
1806        # Reset the figure options
1807        for key in self.default_figure_options:
1808            if isinstance(self.default_figure_options[key], dict):
1809                for sub_key in self.default_figure_options[key]:
1810                    self.figure_options[key][sub_key].set(self.default_figure_options[key][sub_key])
1811                    if key == 'colour':
1812                        colour = self.default_figure_options[key][sub_key]
1813                        self.style.configure(
1814                            f'{sub_key}_colour.TButton',
1815                            background=colour,
1816                            bordercolor=colour,
1817                            lightcolor=colour,
1818                            darkcolor=colour
1819                        )
1820                        self.style.map(
1821                            f'{sub_key}_colour.TButton',
1822                            background=[('active', colour)],
1823                            bordercolor=[('active', colour)],
1824                            lightcolor=[('active', colour)],
1825                            darkcolor=[('active', colour)]
1826                        )
1827                        self.widgets['analysis_view']['colour'][sub_key].configure(style=f'{sub_key}_colour.TButton')
1828            else:
1829                self.figure_options[key].set(self.default_figure_options[key])
1830        # Update the figure
1831        self.update_figure(retain_view=False)
1832
1833    def reset_results(self):
1834        # Reset the trace vectors
1835        self.filtered_trace = None
1836        self.baseline = None
1837        self.pos_threshold = None
1838        self.neg_threshold = None
1839        self.calculation_trace = None
1840        self.event_coordinates = None
1841        # Clear the results
1842        self.analysis_results = dict()
1843        # Update the results
1844        self.update_results()
1845        # Update the figure
1846        self.update_figure(title=' ')
1847        # Set the flags
1848        self.flags['estimated'] = False
1849        self.flags['iterated'] = False
1850        self.flags['saved'] = False
1851
1852    def reset_all(self):
1853        if self.flags['running']:
1854            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
1855            return
1856
1857        # Reset the load window
1858        self.reset_load()
1859        # Reset the 'analyse' window
1860        self.reset_algorithm()
1861        # Reset the results window
1862        self.reset_results()
1863        # Reset the analysis view window
1864        self.reset_figure()
1865
1866    def update_load(self, path):
1867        self.trace_information['path'].set(path)
1868
1869        if path != '':
1870            if len(basename(path)) > 63:
1871                self.trace_information['filename'].set(f'{basename(path)[0:60]}...')
1872            else:
1873                self.trace_information['filename'].set(basename(path))
1874
1875        if self.trace is not None:
1876            self.trace_information['samples'].set(f'{len(self.trace):.0f}')
1877
1878        if self.time_vector is not None:
1879            self.trace_information['sample_rate'].set(f'{1 / self.time_step:.0f}')
1880
1881        if self.time_vector is not None:
1882            self.trace_information['duration'].set(f'{self.time_vector[len(self.time_vector) - 1] - self.time_vector[0]:.1f}')
1883
1884    def update_units(self):
1885        units = self.trace_information['units'].get()
1886        if 'analysis_view' not in self.widgets:
1887            return
1888        if not units:
1889            return
1890        ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
1891        ax.set_ylabel("Current" + f' (${units}$)', fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
1892
1893        if units == 'A':
1894            tooltip.Hovertip(self.widgets['load']['units'], f'Amplitude: A, Duration: ms, Area: C',
1895                             hover_delay=300)
1896        else:
1897            tooltip.Hovertip(self.widgets['load']['units'], f'Amplitude: {units[0]}A, Duration: ms, Area: {units[0]}C',
1898                             hover_delay=300)
1899        # Redraw
1900        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
1901        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
1902
1903    def update_figure(self, title: str = None, retain_view: bool = True):
1904        if self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes:
1905            ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
1906        else:
1907            return
1908
1909        if type(self.time_vector) is np.ndarray and self.time_step:
1910            # Clear lines except the trace
1911            for line in ax.get_lines():
1912                    line.remove()
1913
1914            # Get xlim
1915            xlim = ax.get_xlim() if retain_view else (self.time_vector[0], self.time_vector[len(self.time_vector) - 1])
1916
1917            # Plot the trace
1918            if type(self.trace) is np.ndarray and self.figure_options['show']['trace'].get():
1919                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.trace, xlim), label='trace')
1920
1921            # Plot the calculation trace
1922            if type(self.calculation_trace) is np.ndarray and self.figure_options['show']['calculation_trace'].get():
1923                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.calculation_trace, xlim), label='calculation_trace')
1924
1925            # Plot the filtered trace
1926            if type(self.filtered_trace) is np.ndarray and self.figure_options['show']['filtered_trace'].get():
1927                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.filtered_trace, xlim), label='filtered_trace')
1928
1929            # Plot the baseline
1930            if type(self.baseline) is np.ndarray and self.figure_options['show']['baseline'].get():
1931                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.baseline, xlim), label='baseline')
1932
1933            # Plot the threshold
1934            if (type(self.pos_threshold) is np.ndarray and type(self.baseline) is np.ndarray and
1935                    self.figure_options['show']['threshold'].get()):
1936                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.pos_threshold, xlim), label='threshold')
1937                ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.neg_threshold, xlim), label='threshold')
1938
1939            # Plot the events
1940            if type(self.event_coordinates) is np.ndarray and self.figure_options['show']['events'].get():
1941                ax.plot(*self.downsample_events(xlim), label='events', picker=True, pickradius=5)
1942
1943            # Set visibility, colour, linewidth and linestyle
1944            for line in ax.get_lines():
1945                if line.get_label() not in self.colours.keys():
1946                    continue
1947                line.set_color(self.figure_options['colour'][line.get_label()].get())
1948                line.set_linewidth(self.figure_options['linewidth'][line.get_label()].get())
1949                line.set_linestyle(self.figure_options['style'][line.get_label()].get())
1950                line.set_zorder(self.figure_options['zorder'][line.get_label()])
1951
1952        else:
1953            ax.clear()
1954
1955        # Set limits
1956        if not retain_view:
1957            ax.relim()
1958            ax.autoscale(True)
1959            self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].update()
1960            self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].push_current()
1961            self.update_slider()
1962
1963        # Set title
1964        if title:
1965            ax.set_title(title, fontsize=_LARGE_FONT)
1966
1967        # Set labels and grid
1968        ax.set_xlabel("Time (s)", fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
1969        ax.set_ylabel("Current" + f" (${self.trace_information['units'].get()}$)", fontsize=_MEDIUM_FONT)
1970        ax.grid(self.figure_options['grid'].get())
1971        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].draw_idle()
1972        self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].flush_events()
1973
1974    def update_figure_grid(self):
1975        grid = self.figure_options['grid'].get()
1976        self.figure_options['grid'].set(not grid)
1977        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0].grid(not grid)
1978        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
1979        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
1980
1981    def update_figure_show(self, key):
1982        # Check if the figure is initialised
1983        if self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes:
1984            ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
1985        else:
1986            return
1987
1988        # Check if time vector and time step are initialised
1989        if type(self.time_vector) is not np.ndarray or not self.time_step:
1990            return
1991
1992        show = self.figure_options['show'][key].get()
1993        if not show:
1994            lines = ax.get_lines()
1995            for line in lines:
1996                if key == line.get_label():
1997                    line.remove()
1998        else:
1999            xlim = ax.get_xlim()
2000            lines = []
2001            if key == 'trace' and type(self.trace) is np.ndarray:
2002                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.trace, xlim), label='trace'))
2003            elif key == 'calculation_trace' and type(self.calculation_trace) is np.ndarray:
2004                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.calculation_trace, xlim), label='calculation_trace'))
2005            elif key == 'filtered_trace' and type(self.filtered_trace) is np.ndarray:
2006                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.filtered_trace, xlim), label='filtered_trace'))
2007            elif key == 'baseline' and type(self.baseline) is np.ndarray:
2008                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.baseline, xlim), label='baseline'))
2009            elif key == 'threshold' and type(self.pos_threshold) is np.ndarray and type(self.baseline) is np.ndarray:
2010                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.pos_threshold, xlim), label='threshold'))
2011                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.neg_threshold, xlim), label='threshold'))
2012            elif key == 'events' and type(self.event_coordinates) is np.ndarray:
2013                lines.append(ax.plot(*self.downsample_events(xlim), label='events', picker=True, pickradius=5))
2014            # Set visibility, colour, linewidth and linestyle
2015            for line in lines:
2016                line = line[0]
2017                line.set_color(self.figure_options['colour'][line.get_label()].get())
2018                line.set_linewidth(self.figure_options['linewidth'][line.get_label()].get())
2019                line.set_linestyle(self.figure_options['style'][line.get_label()].get())
2020                line.set_zorder(self.figure_options['zorder'][line.get_label()])
2021        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2022        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
2023
2024    def update_figure_color(self, key):
2025        colour = colorchooser.askcolor(title="Choose color", initialcolor=self.figure_options['colour'][key].get())[1]
2026        if colour is None:
2027            return
2028
2029        self.figure_options['colour'][key].set(colour)
2030        self.style.configure(f'{key}_colour.TButton', background=colour)
2031        self.style.map(f'{key}_colour.TButton', background=[('active', colour)])
2032        self.widgets['analysis_view']['colour'][key].configure(style=f'{key}_colour.TButton')
2033
2034        if not self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes or not self.figure_options['show'][key].get():
2035            return
2036
2037        lines = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0].get_lines()
2038        for line in lines:
2039            if key == line.get_label():
2040                if colour == line.get_color():
2041                    continue
2042                line.set_color(colour)
2043        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2044        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
2045
2046    def update_figure_linewidth(self, key):
2047        if not self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes or not self.figure_options['show'][key].get():
2048            return
2049
2050        width = self.figure_options['linewidth'][key].get()
2051        lines = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0].get_lines()
2052        for line in lines:
2053            if key == line.get_label():
2054                if width == line.get_linewidth():
2055                    continue
2056                line.set_linewidth(width)
2057        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2058        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()

2060    def schedule_update_figure_xlimits(self, limits):
2061        if self.after_id is not None:
2062            self.after_cancel(self.after_id)
2063
2064        self.after_id = self.after(50, self.update_figure_xlimits, limits)

2066    def update_figure_xlimits(self, limits = None):
2067        if limits:
2068            self.after_id = None
2069            ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
2070            ax.set_xlim(limits)
2071            # Downsample all lines
2072            self.downsample_all()
2073            if np.all(np.round(limits, 5) == np.round(ax.get_xlim(), 5)):
2074                # Push state to toolbar
2075                self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].push_current()
2076        else:
2077            mode = self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].mode
2078            if mode not in (mode.ZOOM, mode.PAN):
2079                return
2080            # Downsample all lines
2081            self.downsample_all()
2082        # Redraw
2083        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2084        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
2085

2089        slider.eventson = False

2093    def update_figure_style(self, key):
2094        if not self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes or not self.figure_options['show'][key].get():
2095            return
2096
2097        style = self.figure_options['style'][key].get()
2098        lines = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0].get_lines()
2099        for line in lines:
2100            if key == line.get_label():
2101                if style == line.get_linestyle():
2102                    continue
2103                line.set_linestyle(style)
2104        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2105        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()

2107    def update_results(self):
2108        # Add the final tab
2109        tabs = []
2110        if 'Final' in self.analysis_results.keys():
2111            tabs.append(self.create_tab(self.analysis_results['Final'], 'Final'))
2112
2113        # Add the iteration tab
2114        if 'Iteration' in self.analysis_results.keys():
2115            tab = self.create_iteration_tab()
2116            if tab:
2117                tabs.append(tab)
2118
2119        # Add the estimate tab
2120        if 'Estimate' in self.analysis_results.keys():
2121            tabs.append(self.create_tab(self.analysis_results['Estimate'], 'Estimate'))
2122
2123        # Destroy the old, add the new
2124        for widget in self.widgets['results']['notebook'].winfo_children():
2125            if str(widget) in self.widgets['results']['notebook'].tabs():
2126                self.widgets['results']['notebook'].forget(widget)
2127                widget.destroy()
2128        for tab in tabs:
2129            self.widgets['results']['notebook'].add(tab[0], text=tab[1])
2130        # Feature window
2131        if self.widgets['results']['feature_window']:
2132            self.widgets['results']['feature_window'].destroy()
2133
2134        # Set the last called tab
2135        if self.widgets['results']['notebook'].tabs():
2136            for frame, title in tabs:
2137                if title == self.last_called:
2138                    self.widgets['results']['notebook'].select(frame)
2139                    break
2140            else:
2141                self.widgets['results']['notebook'].select(0)
2142            self.toggle_results('show')
2143        else:
2144            self.toggle_results('hide')

2268    def create_tab(self, results, title):
2269        # Create tab and frames
2270        tab = ttk.Frame(self.widgets['results']['notebook'])
2271        header_separator = ttk.Separator(tab, style='primary.TSeparator')
2272        stats_frame = ttk.Frame(tab)
2273        event_frame = ttk.Frame(tab)
2274        footer_separator = ttk.Separator(tab, style='primary.TSeparator')
2275        feature_window_button = ttk.Button(
2276            tab,
2277            text="Feature Window",
2278            underline=0,
2279            command=self.create_feature_window,
2280            style='Small.secondary.Outline.TButton'
2281        )
2282        self.bind('<f>', lambda _: self.create_feature_window())
2283        tooltip.Hovertip(feature_window_button, 'F')
2284
2285        # Tab layout
2286        tab.columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
2287        header_separator.grid(row=0, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
2288        tab.rowconfigure(1, weight=1)
2289        stats_frame.grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="nsew")
2290        tab.rowconfigure(2, weight=5)
2291        event_frame.grid(row=2, column=0, sticky="nsew")
2292        feature_window_button.grid(row=3, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING, pady=_PADDING)
2293        footer_separator.grid(row=4, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
2294
2295        # Populate the main statistics
2296        main_stats = {**results.trace_stats, **results.event_stats}
2297        labels = []
2298        values = []
2299        seperators = []
2300        stats_frame.columnconfigure(0, weight=2)
2301        stats_frame.columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
2302        row = 0
2303        for i, stat in enumerate(main_stats):
2304            stats_frame.rowconfigure(row, weight=1)
2305            labels.append(ttk.Label(stats_frame, text=stat))
2306            labels[len(labels) - 1].grid(row=row, column=0, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING)
2307            values.append(ttk.Label(stats_frame, text=f'{main_stats[stat]:.6g}'))
2308            values[len(values) - 1].grid(row=row, column=1, sticky="e", padx=_PADDING)
2309            if i != len(main_stats) - 1:
2310                seperators.append(ttk.Separator(stats_frame))
2311                seperators[len(seperators) - 1].grid(row=row + 1, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew")
2312            row += 2
2313
2314        # Populate the event statistics
2315        event_stats = results.events.events
2316        if not event_stats:
2317            return tab, title
2318
2319        first_inner = next(iter(event_stats.values()))
2320        keys = list(first_inner.keys())
2321        table_stats = [{} for i in range(len(event_stats))]
2322        max_width = dict()
2323        # Format
2324        for key in keys:
2325            if key not in self.table_columns:
2326                continue
2327
2328            for i, stat in enumerate(event_stats.values()):
2329                if key == 'Coordinates':
2330                    table_stats[i][key] = f'({stat[key][0]}, {stat[key][1]})'
2331                else:
2332                    table_stats[i][key] = f'{np.round(stat[key], 2):g}'
2333
2334            row_width = max([len(stat[key]) for stat in table_stats]) + 2
2335            row_width *= self.fonts['small'].measure("0")
2336            heading_width = len(str(key)) + 2
2337            heading_width *= self.fonts['small_i'].measure("0")
2338            max_width[key] = row_width if row_width > heading_width else heading_width
2339        for i, stat in enumerate(event_stats.values()):
2340            table_stats[i]['Outlier'] = stat['Outlier']
2341
2342        # Event table
2343        tree = ttk.Treeview(
2344            event_frame,
2345            columns=[key for key in keys if key in self.table_columns],
2346            style='primary.Treeview',
2347            padding=0,
2348            show='headings',
2349        )
2350        # Tags for colours
2351        tree.tag_configure('outlier', background=self.colours['baseline'], foreground='white',
2352                           font=self.fonts['small'])
2353        tree.tag_configure('not_outlier', background='white', foreground=self.style.colors.secondary,
2354                           font=self.fonts['small'])
2355
2356        # Set the headings
2357        for key in keys:
2358            if key not in self.table_columns:
2359                continue
2360
2361            tree.heading(key, anchor='center', text=key, command=lambda _col=key:
2362                         self.sort_column(tree, _col, False))
2363            if key == 'ID':
2364                tree.column(key, width=max_width[key], anchor='w', stretch=1)
2365            else:
2366                tree.column(key, width=max_width[key], anchor='center', stretch=1)
2367
2368        # Populate the table
2369        for i in range(len(table_stats)):
2370            table_data = ()
2371            for key in table_stats[i].keys():
2372                if key not in self.table_columns:
2373                    continue
2374
2375                table_data += (table_stats[i][key],)
2376
2377            tree.insert("", tk.END, text=f'{i + 1}', values=table_data,
2378                        tags=('outlier' if table_stats[i]['Outlier'] else 'not_outlier'))
2379
2380        # Binds
2381        tree.bind("<Double-1>", partial(self.jump_to_event, title))
2382        tree.bind("<Return>", partial(self.jump_to_event, title))
2383        tree.bind("<space>", partial(self.jump_to_event, title))
2384        tree.bind("<Button-3>", partial(self.outlier_event, title))
2385        tree.bind("<Delete>", partial(self.outlier_event, title))
2386        tree.bind("<BackSpace>", partial(self.outlier_event, title))
2387
2388        # Scrollbar
2389        scrollbar = ttk.Scrollbar(event_frame, orient="vertical", command=tree.yview,
2390                                  style='secondary.Vertical.TScrollbar')
2391        tree.configure(yscrollcommand=scrollbar.set)
2392
2393        # Table layout
2394        event_frame.rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
2395        scrollbar.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="ns")
2396        event_frame.columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
2397        tree.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="nsew")
2398
2399        return tab, title
