2401    def create_iteration_tab(self):
2402        if 'Iteration' in self.analysis_results.keys():
2403            trace_stats = self.analysis_results['Iteration']['trace_stats']
2404            event_stats = self.analysis_results['Iteration']['event_stats']
2405        else:
2406            return
2407        if len(trace_stats) < 2 or len(event_stats) < 2:
2408            return
2409
2410        # Create tab and frames
2411        tab = ttk.Frame(self.widgets['results']['notebook'])
2412        header_separator = ttk.Separator(tab, style='primary.TSeparator')
2413        graph_frame = ttk.Frame(tab)
2414
2415        # Tab layout
2416        tab.columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
2417        header_separator.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")
2418        tab.rowconfigure(1, weight=1)
2419        graph_frame.grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="nsew", pady=(0, _PADDING))
2420        footer_separator = ttk.Separator(tab, style='primary.TSeparator')
2421        footer_separator.grid(row=2, column=0, sticky="nsew")
2422
2423        # Graph frame
2424        if self.widgets['results']['notebook'].tabs():
2425            notebook_width = (self.widgets['results']['notebook'].winfo_reqwidth() - 4 * _PADDING) / 100
2426        else:
2427            notebook_width = (self.width // 6 - 4 * _PADDING) / 100
2428        length = len(trace_stats[0].keys()) + len(event_stats[0].keys())
2429        fig = Figure(layout='constrained', dpi=100, figsize=(notebook_width, 1.5 * length))
2430        # Trace stats
2431        x = np.arange(1, len(trace_stats) + 1)
2432        for i, key in enumerate(trace_stats[0].keys()):
2433            ax = fig.add_subplot(length, 1, i + 1)
2434            ax.axvline(x=len(trace_stats), color=self.colours['baseline'], linestyle='--', linewidth=0.5)
2435            ax.plot(x, [stats[key] for stats in trace_stats], label=key, color=self.colours['trace'],
2436                    linewidth=0.5, path_effects=[pe.Stroke(linewidth=1, foreground='black'), pe.Normal()])
2437            ax.scatter(x, [stats[key] for stats in trace_stats], label=key, color=self.colours['threshold'],
2438                       path_effects=[pe.Stroke(linewidth=2, foreground='black'), pe.Normal()])
2439            ax.set_title(key, fontsize=_SMALL_FONT)
2440            ax.tick_params(axis='both', which='both', labelsize=_SMALL_FONT - 2)
2441            ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(MaxNLocator(integer=True))
2442        # Event stats
2443        x = np.arange(1, len(event_stats) + 1)
2444        for i, key in enumerate(event_stats[0].keys()):
2445            ax = fig.add_subplot(length, 1, i + 1 + len(trace_stats[0].keys()))
2446            ax.axvline(x=len(trace_stats), color=self.colours['baseline'], linestyle='--', linewidth=0.5)
2447            ax.plot(x, [stats[key] for stats in event_stats], label=key, color=self.colours['trace'],
2448                    linewidth=0.5, path_effects=[pe.Stroke(linewidth=1, foreground='black'), pe.Normal()])
2449            ax.scatter(x, [stats[key] for stats in event_stats], label=key, color=self.colours['threshold'],
2450                       path_effects=[pe.Stroke(linewidth=2, foreground='black'), pe.Normal()])
2451            ax.set_title(key, fontsize=_SMALL_FONT)
2452            ax.tick_params(axis='both', which='both', labelsize=_SMALL_FONT - 2)
2453            ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(MaxNLocator(integer=True))
2454        fig.supxlabel('Iteration', fontsize=_SMALL_FONT)
2455        # Margins and share x ticks
2456        for axis in fig.get_axes():
2457            axis.margins(x=0.1, y=0.1)
2458            axis.format_coord = lambda x, y: f'y = {y:.4f}'
2459        for ax in fig.get_axes()[1:]:
2460            ax.sharex(fig.get_axes()[0])
2461
2462        # Inner canvas and scrollbar
2463        inner_canvas = tk.Canvas(graph_frame)
2464        graph_scrollbar = ttk.Scrollbar(graph_frame, orient="vertical", style='secondary.Vertical.TScrollbar')
2465        # Configure the canvas size and scrollbar
2466        size = fig.get_size_inches() * fig.dpi
2467        inner_canvas.configure(width=size[0])
2468        inner_canvas.config(yscrollcommand=graph_scrollbar.set, scrollregion=(0, 0, 0, size[1]),
2469                            yscrollincrement=size[1] / (length * 10))
2470        graph_scrollbar.config(command=inner_canvas.yview)
2471        # Graph frame layout
2472        graph_frame.rowconfigure(2, weight=1)
2473        graph_scrollbar.grid(row=2, column=0, sticky="ns")
2474        graph_frame.columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
2475        inner_canvas.grid(row=2, column=1, sticky="nsew")
2476
2477        # Inner frame inside inner canvas
2478        inner_frame = ttk.Frame(inner_canvas)
2479        inner_canvas.create_window(0, 0, window=inner_frame, anchor=tk.NW)
2480        # Plot inside inner frame... inside inner canvas
2481        canvas = FigureCanvasTkAgg(fig, inner_frame)
2482        # Create toolbar
2483        toolbar = NavigationToolbar2Tk(canvas, graph_frame, pack_toolbar=False)
2484        for child in toolbar.winfo_children():
2485            child.pack_forget()
2486            child.configure(background='white', border=1)
2487        for child in toolbar.winfo_children():
2488            if child != toolbar.children['!button4']:
2489                child.pack(side=tk.LEFT)
2490        toolbar.update()
2491        toolbar.push_current()
2492        toolbar.grid(row=0, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew", padx=_PADDING)
2493        toolbar_separator = ttk.Separator(graph_frame)
2494        toolbar_separator.grid(row=1, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew", pady=(0, _PADDING))
2495        canvas.get_tk_widget().pack(side=tk.TOP, fill=tk.BOTH, expand=1)
2496        canvas.draw_idle()
2497        canvas.flush_events()
2498
2499        return tab, 'Iteration'

2501    def sort_column(self, tree, col, reverse):
2502        def check_column(value):
2503            try:
2504                return float(value[0])
2505            except:
2506                return float(eval(value[0])[0])
2507
2508        l = [(tree.set(k, col), k) for k in tree.get_children('')]
2509        l.sort(reverse=reverse, key=check_column)
2510
2511        for index, (val, k) in enumerate(l):
2512            tree.move(k, '', index)
2513
2514        tree.heading(col, command=lambda: self.sort_column(tree, col, not reverse))
2515
2516    def outlier_event(self, title, event):
2517        # Get the event ID
2518        tree = event.widget
2519        if not tree.selection():
2520            return
2521
2522        events = self.analysis_results[title].events
2523        for item in tree.selection():
2524            event_id = int(tree.item(item, 'text'))
2525
2526            # Toggle the outlier flag
2527            if events.get(event_id)['Outlier']:
2528                events.get(event_id)['Outlier'] = False
2529                tree.item(item, tags='not_outlier')
2530            else:
2531                events.get(event_id)['Outlier'] = True
2532                tree.item(item, tags='outlier')
2533
2534        event_coordinates = []
2535        for event in events:
2536            if not event['Outlier']:
2537                event_coordinates.append(event['Coordinates'])
2538
2539        # Recalculate cutoff
2540        try:
2541            self.analysis_results[title].event_stats['Max Cutoff'] = np.round(
2542                nn.methods._calculate_cutoffs(
2543                    self.trace,
2544                    self.baseline,
2545                    self.initial_threshold,
2546                    np.asarray(event_coordinates, dtype=np.int64),
2547                    self.current_cutoff,
2548                    int(1 / self.time_step)
2549                )[0],
2550                2
2551            )
2552        except IndexError:
2553            self.analysis_results[title].event_stats['Max Cutoff'] = self.analysis_options['estimate_cutoff'].get()
2554
2555        self.analysis_options['cutoff'].set(self.analysis_results[title].event_stats['Max Cutoff'])
2556        self.flash_entry(self.widgets['analyse']['cutoff_input'])
2557
2558        # Update the feature window figure
2559        if self.widgets['results']['feature_window']:
2560            self.widgets['results']['feature_window'].update_all_figures()
2561
2562    def jump_to_event(self, title, event):
2563        # Get the event ID
2564        tree = event.widget
2565        if not tree.selection():
2566            return
2567        item = tree.selection()[0]
2568        event_id = int(tree.item(item, 'text'))
2569
2570        events = self.analysis_results[title].events
2571        # Get the event coordinates
2572        event_coordinates = events.get(event_id)['Coordinates']
2573        extra = (event_coordinates[1] - event_coordinates[0]) * 10
2574        start = event_coordinates[0] - extra if event_coordinates[0] - extra > 0 else 0
2575        end = event_coordinates[1] + extra if event_coordinates[1] + extra < len(self.trace) else len(self.trace) - 1
2576
2577        # Flash the event
2578        def remove():
2579            try:
2580                line[0].remove()
2581            except:
2582                return
2583            self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2584            self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
2585
2586        ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
2587        line = ax.plot(self.time_vector[event_coordinates[0]:event_coordinates[1] + 1],
2588                       self.trace[event_coordinates[0]:event_coordinates[1] + 1], 'r', linewidth=3, zorder=8)
2589        trace_min = np.min(self.trace[start:end])
2590        trace_max = np.max(self.trace[start:end])
2591        difference = 0.5 * abs(trace_max - trace_min)
2592        self.update_figure_xlimits((start * self.time_step + self.time_vector[0], end * self.time_step + self.time_vector[0]))
2593        ax.set(ylim=(trace_min - difference, trace_max + difference))
2594        self.widgets['analysis_view']['toolbar'].push_current()
2595        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.draw_idle()
2596        self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].canvas.flush_events()
2597        self.after(500, remove)

2599    def pick_event(self, event):
2600        # Convert point to event coordinates
2601        point = np.round((event.artist.get_xdata()[event.ind[0]] - self.time_vector[0]) / self.time_step)
2602
2603        # Get currently shown events

2615            if coords[0] <= (point + 5) and coords[1] >= (point - 5):
2616                event_id = event['ID']
2617                break
2618
2619        if event_id is None:
2620            return
2621
2622        # Select the tab
2623        for i in self.widgets['results']['notebook'].tabs():
2624            if self.widgets['results']['notebook'].tab(i, "text") == label:
2625                self.widgets['results']['notebook'].select(i)
2626                break
2627

2630        tree = tab.winfo_children()[2].winfo_children()[0]

2641                break

2655    def flash_entry(self, entry):
2656        current = entry.cget('style')
2657

2659                             relief='raised', foreground=self.style.colors.primary)

2665    def downsample_line(self, x, y, xlim, max_points=None):
2666        if max_points is None:
2667            max_points = int(self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].get_tk_widget().winfo_width())
2668            if max_points <= 1:
2669                max_points = int(self.width / 6 * 4)
2670
2671        # Mask to xlim support
2672        mask1 = np.searchsorted(x, xlim[0], 'left')
2673        mask2 = np.searchsorted(x, xlim[1], 'right')
2674        x_visible = x[mask1:mask2]
2675        y_visible = y[mask1:mask2]
2676        length = len(x_visible)
2677        if length <= max_points:
2678            return x_visible, y_visible
2679
2680        # Equally spaced bin edges
2681        starts, ends = _get_edges(length, max_points)
2682
2683        # Per bin min and max
2684        y_min = np.minimum.reduceat(y_visible, starts)
2685        y_max = np.maximum.reduceat(y_visible, starts)
2686
2687        # Allocate
2688        x_out = np.empty(2 * max_points, dtype=x_visible.dtype)
2689        y_out = np.empty(2 * max_points, dtype=y_visible.dtype)
2690
2691        # Fill the output arrays
2692        x_out[0::2] = x_visible[starts]
2693        x_out[1::2] = x_visible[ends - 1]
2694        y_out[0::2] = y_min
2695        y_out[1::2] = y_max
2696
2697        return x_out, y_out
2698
2699    def downsample_events(self, xlim):
2700        # Total width budget
2701        width = int(self.widgets['analysis_view']['canvas'].get_tk_widget().winfo_width())
2702        if width <= 1:
2703            width = int(self.width / 6 * 4)
2704
2705        # Save lookups
2706        coords = np.asarray(self.event_coordinates, dtype=int)
2707        tv = self.time_vector
2708        tr = self.trace
2709
2710        # Mask to xlim support
2711        visible = coords[(tv[coords[:, 1]] >= xlim[0]) & (tv[coords[:, 0]] <= xlim[1])]
2712        if len(visible) == 0:
2713            return np.array([], dtype=object), np.array([], dtype=object)
2714
2715        # At least 2 pixels per segment
2716        per_seg = max(2, width // len(visible))
2717
2718        # Downsample each visible event
2719        x_out, y_out = [], []
2720        for start, end in visible:
2721            # Grab and clamp each segment
2722            seg_x = tv[start:end + 1]
2723            seg_y = tr[start:end + 1]
2724            mask = (seg_x >= xlim[0]) & (seg_x <= xlim[1])
2725            if not mask.any():
2726                continue
2727            seg_x = seg_x[mask]
2728            seg_y = seg_y[mask]
2729
2730            # Downsample this segment with its own budget
2731            xs, ys = self.downsample_line(
2732                seg_x, seg_y,
2733                xlim=(seg_x[0], seg_x[len(seg_x) - 1]),
2734                max_points=per_seg
2735            )
2736
2737            x_out.extend(xs)
2738            x_out.append(None)
2739            y_out.extend(ys)
2740            y_out.append(None)
2741
2742        return np.array(x_out, dtype=object), np.array(y_out, dtype=object)
2743
2744    def downsample_all(self):
2745        ax = self.widgets['analysis_view']['fig'].axes[0]
2746        xlim = ax.get_xlim()
2747        thresh = 0
2748        for line in ax.get_lines():
2749            if line.get_label() not in self.colours.keys():
2750                continue
2751            if line.get_label() == 'threshold':
2752                if thresh == 0:
2753                    line.set_data(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.pos_threshold, xlim))
2754                else:
2755                    line.set_data(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, self.neg_threshold, xlim))
2756                thresh += 1
2757            elif line.get_label() == 'events':
2758                line.set_data(*self.downsample_events(xlim))
2759            else:
2760                line.set_data(*self.downsample_line(self.time_vector, getattr(self, line.get_label()), xlim))

2776    def process_results(self, results):
2777        n = len(results.iterations)
2778        label = 'Final' if isinstance(results, IterateResults) else 'Estimate'
2779        self.last_called = label
2780        self.analysis_results[label] = results.iterations[n - 1]
2781        self.analysis_results[label].events = results.events
2782        self.analysis_results[label].events.label = label
2783        self.analysis_results[label].initial_threshold = results.initial_threshold
2784
2785        if isinstance(results, IterateResults):
2786            self.analysis_results['Iteration'] = dict(
2787                trace_stats=[res.trace_stats for res in results.iterations],
2788                event_stats=[res.event_stats for res in results.iterations])
2789            self.current_cutoff = self.analysis_options['cutoff'].get()
2790        else:
2791            self.analysis_results[label].trace_stats = results.iterations[0].trace_stats
2792            self.analysis_results[label].event_direction = results.event_direction
2793            self.current_cutoff = self.analysis_options['estimate_cutoff'].get()
2794
2795        self.initial_threshold = self.analysis_results[label].initial_threshold
2796        self.calculation_trace = self.analysis_results[label].calculation_trace
2797        self.baseline = self.analysis_results[label].baseline
2798        self.pos_threshold = self.analysis_results[label].baseline + self.analysis_results[label].threshold
2799        self.neg_threshold = self.analysis_results[label].baseline - self.analysis_results[label].threshold
2800        self.event_coordinates = self.analysis_results[label].event_coordinates
2801
2802        # Update the results window
2803        self.update_results()
2804        self.update()
2805        # Show the vectors
2806        self.update_figure(title=label)
2807
2808        # Update the direction for estimate only
2809        if label == 'Estimate':
2810            self.analysis_options['event_direction'].set(self.analysis_results[label].event_direction)
2811            self.flash_entry(self.widgets['analyse']['event_direction_input'])
2812
2813        # Update the cutoff
2814        self.analysis_options['cutoff'].set(np.round(self.analysis_results[label].event_stats['Max Cutoff'], 2))
2815        self.flash_entry(self.widgets['analyse']['cutoff_input'])

2817    def load_trace(self):
2818        if self.flags['running']:
2819            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
2820            return
2821
2822        path = filedialog.askopenfilename(
2823            initialdir="/" if self.trace_information['path'].get() == ''
2824                           else os.path.split(self.trace_information['path'].get())[0],
2825            title="Choose a file",
2826            filetypes=(("All", "*.abf *.csv *.tsv *.txt *.dat"), ("ABF files", "*.abf"), ("CSV files", "*.csv"),
2827                       ("TSV files", "*.tsv"), ("Text files", "*.txt"), ("Data files", "*.dat"))
2828        )
2829        if path == '' or path is None:
2830            return
2831
2832        current_time = time.time()
2833        try:
2834            # Axon binary format
2835            if path.endswith('.abf'):
2836                data = pyabf.ABF(path)
2837                trace = data.sweepY.astype(float)
2838                time_vector = data.sweepX.astype(float)
2839                units = getattr(data, "sweepUnitsY", "pA")
2840            # Separated format
2841            elif path.endswith('.csv') or path.endswith('.tsv') or path.endswith('.txt') or path.endswith('.dat'):
2842                with open(path, newline='') as csvfile:
2843                    dialect = csv.Sniffer().sniff(csvfile.read(1024))
2844                    csvfile.seek(0)
2845                    reader = csv.reader(csvfile, dialect)
2846                    next(reader)
2847                    trace = []
2848                    time_vector = []
2849                    for row in reader:
2850                        trace.append(row[1])
2851                        time_vector.append(row[0])
2852                    trace = np.asarray(trace, dtype=float)
2853                    time_vector = np.asarray(time_vector, dtype=float)
2854                    units = 'pA'
2855            else:
2856                raise ValueError('File type not supported')
2857            time_step = time_vector[1] - time_vector[0]
2858        except Exception as e:
2859            messagebox.showerror('Error', f'Loading failed: {repr(e)}')
2860            return
2861        print(f'Loading time: {time.time() - current_time:.4f}')
2862
2863        self.reset_all()
2864        # Update the trace vectors
2865        self.trace = trace
2866        self.time_vector = time_vector
2867        self.time_step = time_step
2868        # Update the trace information
2869        self.trace_information['units'].set(units)
2870        # Show the trace information and trace vector
2871        self.update_load(path)
2872        # Initialise the slider
2873        self.init_slider()
2874        # Update the figure
2875        self.update_figure(title='Trace', retain_view=False)
2876        # Set the z-score
2877        self.analysis_options['z_score'].set(np.round(norm.ppf(1.0 - ((1.0 / len(self.trace)) / 2.0)), 3))
2878        self.default_analysis_options['z_score'] = self.analysis_options['z_score'].get()
2879        self.flash_entry(self.widgets['analyse']['z_score_input'])
2880        # Disable iterate options
2881        self.toggle_iterate_options(['disabled'])
2882        # Set the flag
2883        self.flags['loaded'] = True
2884
2885    def landing_load(self):
2886        self.load_trace()

2891    def check_thread(self, thread, results, errors, current_time, title):
2892        self.flags['running'] = True
2893
2894        # Check for errors
2895        if not errors.empty():
2896            self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'].stop()
2897            self.flags['running'] = False
2898            messagebox.showerror('Error', f'{title} failed: {errors.get()}')
2899            return
2900
2901        # Reschedule check
2902        if thread.is_alive():
2903            self.after(100, lambda: self.check_thread(thread, results, errors, current_time, title))
2904            return
2905
2906        # Get results
2907        thread.join()
2908        self.update_idletasks()
2909        try:
2910            results = results.get_nowait()
2911        except queue.Empty:
2912            self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'].stop()
2913            self.flags['running'] = False
2914            messagebox.showerror('Error', f'{title} failed: No results returned')
2915            return
2916
2917        # Update analysis results
2918        print(f'{title} time: {time.time() - current_time:.4f}')
2919        self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'].stop()
2920        self.flags['running'] = False
2921        self.process_results(results)
2922        # Set the focus and flag
2923        if title == 'Estimate':
2924            self.widgets['analyse']['iterate'].focus_set()
2925            self.flags['estimated'] = True
2926            # Enable iterate options
2927            self.toggle_iterate_options(['!disabled'])
2928        else:
2929            self.widgets['results']['save'].focus_set()
2930            self.flags['iterated'] = True
2931
2932    def initial_estimate(self):
2933        if not self.flags['loaded']:
2934            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Trace not loaded')
2935            return
2936        if self.flags['running']:
2937            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
2938            return
2939
2940        current_time = time.time()
2941        self.widgets['analysis_view']['progress_bar'].start(10)
2942
2943        # Filter the trace
2944        self.filtered_trace = nn.methods._bounds_filter(self.trace, self.analysis_options['_bounds_filter'].get())
2945
2946        # Estimate the cutoff and direction
2947        def worker(results, errors,  *args):
2948            try:
2949                results.put(nn.initial_estimate(*args))
2950            except Exception as e:
2951                errors.put(str(e))
2952                return
2953
2954        # Run on a separate thread
2955        results = queue.Queue()
2956        errors = queue.Queue()
2957        thread = Thread(
2958            target=worker,
2959            args=(
2960                results,
2961                errors,
2962                self.trace,
2963                self.filtered_trace,
2964                int(1 / self.time_step),
2965                self.analysis_options['estimate_cutoff'].get(),
2966                self.analysis_options['replace_factor'].get(),
2967                self.analysis_options['replace_gap'].get(),
2968                self.analysis_options['threshold_window'].get(),
2969                self.analysis_options['z_score'].get(),
2970            ),
2971            daemon=True
2972        )
2973        thread.start()
2974        self.check_thread(thread, results, errors, current_time, 'Estimate')

2976    def iterate(self):
2977        if not self.flags['loaded']:
2978            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Trace not loaded')
2979            return
2980        if self.flags['running']:
2981            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')

2986
2987        # Filter the trace
2988        self.filtered_trace = nn.methods._bounds_filter(self.trace, self.analysis_options['_bounds_filter'].get())
2989
2990        # Iterate to find the final baseline and threshold
2991        def worker(results, errors, *args):
2992            try:
2993                if self.analysis_options['parallel'].get():
2994                    results.put(nn.parallel_iterate(*args))
2995                else:
2996                    results.put(nn.iterate(*args))
2997            except Exception as e:
2998                errors.put(str(e))
2999                return
3000
3001        # Run on a separate thread
3002        results = queue.Queue()
3003        errors = queue.Queue()
3004        thread = Thread(
3005            target=worker,
3006            args=(
3007                results,
3008                errors,
3009                self.trace,
3010                self.analysis_options['cutoff'].get(),
3011                self.analysis_options['event_direction'].get(),
3012                self.filtered_trace,
3013                int(1 / self.time_step),
3014                self.analysis_options['replace_factor'].get(),
3015                self.analysis_options['replace_gap'].get(),
3016                self.analysis_options['threshold_window'].get(),
3017                self.analysis_options['z_score'].get()
3018            ),
3019            daemon=True
3020        )
3021        thread.start()
3022        self.check_thread(thread, results, errors, current_time, 'Iteration')

3024    def save_results(self):
3025        if not self.flags['iterated'] and not self.flags['estimated']:
3026            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'No results to save')
3027            return
3028        if self.flags['running']:
3029            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'Work in progress')
3030            return
3031        if self.flags['iterated']:
3032            results = copy.deepcopy(self.analysis_results['Final'].events)
3033            label = 'final'
3034        else:
3035            results = copy.deepcopy(self.analysis_results['Estimate'].events)
3036            label = 'estimate'
3037        if not results:
3038            messagebox.showerror('Error', 'No results to save')
3039            return
3040
3041        # Save the results
3042        path = tk.filedialog.asksaveasfile(
3043            initialfile=basename(self.trace_information['path'].get()).split('.')[0] + f'_{label}.csv',
3044            defaultextension=".csv",
3045            initialdir=os.path.split(self.trace_information['path'].get())[0],
3046            title="Choose a location",
3047            filetypes=([("CSV files", "*.csv")])
3048        )
3049        if path == '' or path is None:
3050            return
3051
3052        # If you don't do this, DictWriter will ruin your life :( (** 2 bcos of excel cell size limit)
3053        units = self.trace_information['units'].get()
3054        amp_key = 'Amplitude (A)' if units == 'A' else f'Amplitude ({units[0]}A)'
3055        area_key = 'Area (C)' if units == 'A' else f'Area ({units[0]}C)'
3056        for event in results:
3057            packed = b"".join(struct.pack("d", num) for num in list(event.pop('Vector')))
3058            event['Vector (Base64)'] = base64.b64encode(packed).decode()
3059            event['Duration (ms)'] = event.pop('Duration')
3060            event['Max Cutoff (Hz)'] = event.pop('Max Cutoff')
3061            event[area_key] = event.pop('Area')
3062            event[amp_key] = event.pop('Amplitude')
3063
3064        fieldnames = [
3065            'ID',
3066            'Direction',
3067            amp_key,
3068            'Duration (ms)',
3069            area_key,
3070            'Max Cutoff (Hz)',
3071            'Coordinates',
3072            'Outlier',
3073            'Vector (Base64)',
3074        ]
3075
3076        with open(path.name, 'w', encoding='utf8', newline='') as path:
3077            w = csv.DictWriter(path, fieldnames)
3078            w.writeheader()
3079            w.writerows(results)
3080
3081        # Success
3082        messagebox.showinfo('Success', f'Saved {label} results')
3083
3084        # Set the flag
3085        self.flags['saved'] = True

Return a new top level widget on screen SCREENNAME. A new Tcl interpreter will be created. BASENAME will be used for the identification of the profile file (see readprofile). It is constructed from sys.argv[0] without extensions if None is given. CLASSNAME is the name of the widget class.
